texts.en: Rose sells fish. She is 40 years old, married, and has 1 child. The child does not go to school. Rose borrowed a loan to stock more fish to sell. She hopes to expand her business in the future with the extra profits.

loans.use: to stock more fish to sell.

loans.name: Donatha

texts.en:
Donatha is 22 years old. She has 2 children who are aged 6 months and 2 years old. The elder child is in school. Her husband is a technician. 

Donatha is a tailor. She has done this business for 2 years and her business is going on well. She is requesting a loan to expand her business house, in which she does her tailoring. She plans to open up a general store with the profits that she plans to make. This way, she will have two businesses in order to make more profits.

loans.use: to expand her business house.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is 24 years old and a single mother to a 3 year old child. She is a tailor in Kiganjo. She has been running her business for a period of about 2 years, with an income of approximately 5,000 Kenya shillings a month.

This is her first loan with KADET, after being introduced to Kadet by a friend. She wants to use the loan to buy cosmetics for her shop and materials to make clothes, which she will later sell. She hopes to buy a piece of land and develop it in order to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics for her shop and material to make clothes.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 52 and is a married woman with 5 children. The oldest child is 25. Her husband works as a farmer.

She is a fruit and vegetable dealer working in Banga, Agusan Del Sur. She has been in this kind of business for 15 years. Letecia also raises pigs to help augment their income. She earns 15,000 PHP per month from her businesses.

This loan will be used to purchase pig feeds, fertilizers and more fruits and vegetables to resell. In the future, she hopes to expand her business and help her family and others.

loans.use: to purchase pig feeds, fertilizers and more fruits and vegetables to resell

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 31 years old and married to Annastacia. Together, they have a 5-year-old child. He has been a vegetable vendor for a year and hopes to open up a permanent retail shop someday. Francis currently earns around 9,000 KES a month from his business. He intends to take an 8,000 KES loan to buy more vegetables, bananas, and coal that he will sell as a vegetable vendor.  

Francis learned about KADET Ltd. through a KADET staff member. This is his first loan with KADET. He plans to use the proceeds from the loan to expand his business. He hopes to open a retail shop one day.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables, bananas, and coal that he will sell as a vegetable vendor.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 43 years old and married to his wife, Rahab. He has been selling clean water to his community for over 11 years. John intends to take a 50,000 KES loan to buy distilled water in large quantities for his business. 

John has been a good client who repays his loan well. This is his second loan with KADET. As a hardworking individual, he plans to use the proceeds from this loan to expand his business. He hopes to become a wholesaler of a water depot one day.

loans.use: to buy distilled water in large quantities for his business

loans.name: Beatha

texts.en:
Beatha is 40 years old and has 6 children who are ages 5-22 years old. Her husband is a farmer. She sells malt (soaked sorghum) and she has done this business for many years.

From the profits she makes from this business, she can afford to pay her children’s school fees, medical insurance and feed her family. She is requesting a loan to buy more sorghum for her to make more savings. She plans to save all her profits.

loans.use: to buy sorghum

loans.name: Winfred

texts.en:
Winfred is 40 years old and married. She has been running a tailoring business for 11 years and earns around 10,000 KES a month. Winfred intends to take a 10,000 KES loan to buy more materials to make clothes.  

Winfred has been a good client who repays her loans well. This is her fourth loan with KADET. As a trustworthy and hardworking individual, she plans to use the proceeds from this loan to expand her business and become financially stable.

loans.use: to buy materials to make clothes

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena is 65. She is a married woman with 8 children. Her husband works as a farmer.

Magdalena is also a farmer. She helps her husband till their land to grow rice crops and vegetables. She also raises pigs to help augment their income. 

This loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and pig feed. In the future, she hopes to improve her business to help her family financially.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pig feed.

loans.name: Filipina

texts.en:
Filipina is a 51-year-old single woman living in the village of Dumabato Sur Maddela Quirino. Filipina has two children who are already married.

She earns about PHP 20,000 after she sells one of her piglets. Filipina said that through her business, she is able to sustain the needs of her children during their school days until such time that they finished their tertiary level of education.

Filipina has been in the business of hog raising for almost 10 years. She plans to use this loan to buy feed, supplies and vaccines for her hogs.

In the future, Filipina hopes to maintain this kind of business because this is the main source of income for the family. She will be grateful if her requested loan is granted because this will be helpful in maintaining her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, supplies and vaccines for her hogs

loans.name: Tsengelmaa

texts.en:
Tsengelmaa, 25, is a young hardworking woman. She helps support her family and lives with her two young sisters and father in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

Tsengelmaa works as an accountant at a local small company. Besides beig an accountant, she also operates a grocery store with her oldest sister. Her youngest sister is a student, while her father is retired. Tsengelmaa pays her youngest sister’s school fees. 

Tsengelmaa and her family live in a small house and their house is old and uncomfortable. They want to become safe and comfortable in their home, so they will their house. Tsengelmaa is applying for a loan of 1,800,000 MNT to rehabilitate the roof, walls and windows of their house.

loans.use: to rehabilitate her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a cow for her farm.

loans.name: Eugenie

texts.en:
Eugenie is 30 years old. She has 4 children who are aged 3-9 years old. Two are in school while the other 2 are not yet at school age. Eugenie’s husband works with her. She sells food stuffs and she has done this business for 7 years. With this business, they have been able to afford to meet their needs and they have also met the needs of their family. 

Eugenie is requesting a loan to buy green bananas and other food stuffs in order to make more profits. She plans to renovate her house with the profits that she hopes to make.

loans.use: to buy food stuffs, such as green bananas.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia is 60 years old and married to a farmer. The couple is blessed with six children. Leticia sells grocery items in her store and has operated this business for almost seven years. She's asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase detergent bars/powders, carbonated drinks, cooking oil, vinegar, condiments, eggs, and canned goods. She earns 7,000 PHP monthly from this business.

She hopes that Kiva lenders will continue to support her in the future, as she looks to expand her business and eventually increase her income.

loans.use: To purchase detergent bars/powders, carbonated drinks, cooking oil, vinegar, condiments, eggs, and canned goods.

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas has been running a retail shop for one year in Tala town. Most of his customers are local people who are mostly farmers. He earns an income of KES 1,500 per month. He is married and a father of six children, all in schooling.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by a member of KADET, and he has borrowed from FAULU Kenya (MFI). This is his first loan. He intends to use the entire loan amount to add more stock to the retail shop.

In the future, he desires to grow his business and to improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: to buy more stock for the retail shop, e.g sugar, maize flour, cooking oil.

loans.name: Romie

texts.en:
Romie is 45 years old and married with three school-aged children. Romie is a farmer working in the Philippines and earns PHP 30,000 per harvest. 

Romie is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. Romie has been growing rice for almost nine years.

In the future, Romie hopes that his farming business will be more progressive and support the increasing needs of his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Norlyn

texts.en:
Norlyn is 27 and is a married woman with a five-year-old child. She and her husband are both farmers. Her husband mainly manages their farm. Norlyn helps grow corn crops and sell their harvest. She also sells pork and chicken barbecue to the people in her community. She earns about 3000 Philippine pesos (PHP) per month from selling barbecue. 

This loan will be used to purchase fertilizers for the farm and ingredients for barbecue such as pork and chicken meat. In the future, she hopes to expand her farming business and be successful in selling barbecue.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farm and ingredients for her barbecue foods business

loans.name: Didancienne

texts.en:
Didancienne is 56 years old, she has four children who are between the ages of eight and sixteen. Her husband is a farmer. She raises cows and goats. She has done this business for 21 years. 

She is requesting a loan to buy more animals in order to get more produce from them. She thinks of renovating her house with the profits she hopes to make.

loans.use: to buy livestock to raise and sell

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en: Dominga, 63 years of age, is married and blessed with five children. She has had a retail store in their village for almost five years. She earns 9,000 PHP monthly. She is asking for a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase additional grocery items to sell in her store. She hopes to start another business to increase her revenue and to continue borrowing from Kiva lenders to help reach her business goals.

loans.use: To purchase additional grocery items to sell

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick has been selling clothes for about three years and earns 15,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) per month. He also has a motorbike which he uses to offer transport services to his neighbours while his wife, Stella, manages the clothes business. Patrick and Stella do not have any children yet. 

He was introduced to KADET Ltd. by a group already registered with KADET and he is applying for his second loan of 60,000 KES with which he plans to buy more second-hand clothes for sale. 

In the future he plans to grow his business and own a boutique.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothes for sale

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a married woman with a 26-year-old child. She is engaged in farming and hog-raising businesses. She helps her husband grow rice and corn. They own a cow that is very useful in tilling the land. While her husband mainly manages the farm, she focuses on keeping her piggery clean and the pigs healthy. Rosemarie earns about 5000 Philippine pesos (PHP) per month. 

This loan will be used to purchase piglets and feed. In the future, she hopes to be rich and expand her business and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farm supplies.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en: Corazon, 52 years of age, is married and blessed with two children. She has a retail store that she has operated for almost two years. She earns 4,000 PHP monthly and she's asking for a loan of 9,000 PHP to purchase additional grocery items to sell such as canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee. She also sells personal products in their village. She hopes to start another income-generating source for her to provide the family's daily needs.

loans.use: To purchase additional canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee to sell

location.town: Christine Village, District 1, Cauayan City, Isabe

loans.name: Farijika Group

texts.fr: La cliente Katungu est entrepreneur, leader du groupe d’affaire « Farijika »,  âgée de 42 ans, mariée, mère de 7 enfants. Son mari est un hôtelier. La cliente est vendeuse poissons frais au marché communal de Katindo-Alanine.  Il ya 12 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Elle vient de réaliser 15 cycles avec le crédit de Hekima. Elle démarra son business avec  20$ reçu de son mari. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec  4 paniers de poissons frais et le reste sera affecté aux mini projets de ménage.  En plus, elle ambitionne agrandir son entreprise, scolariser ses enfants et construire une maison pour la location.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres exclus de banque classique. Il sied de signaler que le groupe d’affaire «  Farijika» est majoritairement féminins.
texts.en:
The client Katungu is an entrepreneur, and the leader of the business group Farijika. She is 42, married, and the mother of seven children. Her husband is a hotel operator.

Katungu sells fresh fish at the communal market in Katindo-Alanine. She has been in this business for twelve years.  She has just finished her 15th loan cycle with Hekima. Her business began with $20 received from her husband. 

The new loan should help her stock up with four baskets of fresh fish, and the rest will go to the family's small projects. 

Furthermore, she hopes to build her business, school her children, and build a house to rent out. 

The client thanks Hekima for its work to help the poor who are normally excluded from a classic bank. It should be said that the business group Farijika consists primarily of women.

loans.use: to buy four baskets.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Mansavo Group

texts.fr: MANSAVO est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres habitent tous ensemble dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Jeannette(dont la main est levée sur la photo), est née en 1982 et est mariée à un certain Cyprien. Le couple a quatre enfants à charge, tous scolarisés, dont trois sont les leurs. Jeannette et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants et supportent ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Jeannette n’a jamais été à l’école. Pour faire face à ses besoins, Jeannette vend des produits divers (biscuits, bombons, etc.) dans son quartier. Jeannette achète ses produits au Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Jeannette sollicite pour la première fois un crédit avec les membres de son groupe. Ce crédit leur servira à renforcer leur activité et à augmenter leur chiffre d'affaire et leur revenu.
texts.en:
MANSAVO is a group of three people whose members all live in the same neighborhood. The group’s representative, Jeannette, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. She was born in 1982 and is married to a man named Cyprien. This couple has four children to support. All the children are in school, and three of them are their own. Jeannette and her husband live together with their children and jointly cover the various household expenses.

Jeannette never attended school. To address her needs, she sells various goods (cookies, candies, etc.) in her neighborhood. She purchases her goods in Benin. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers, Jeannette, along with the other members of her group, is requesting a loan for the first time. This loan will serve to bolster their businesses and to increase their turnover and their revenues.

loans.use: to buy various goods (boxes of cookies, candies, etc.)

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary sells fish. She is 30 years old, married, with 2 children and all of them go to school. Mary borrowed a loan to stock more fish to sell. She hopes to expand her business in the future with extra profits.

loans.use: stock more fish to sell.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen has been practicing farming in Narok, Kenya for the last six years. He is 24 years old, single and supports his parents. He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and is now applying for his first loan. He plans to use the loan to buy maize seeds and fertilizer, and also hire temporary field workers to assist him in planting. In the future, he hopes to become a leading farmer in Narok town. He is very happy with his life and grateful to have the support of Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy maize seeds and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is a married woman with 7 children. Her oldest child is 27 years old.

Rosie is a farmer working in Banga, Agusan del sur. She has been growing corn and vegetables for 5 years. She earns 4,000 PHP per month doing this farming. 

This loan will be used to purchase fertilizer, seeds, and pesticides. In the future, she hopes to be a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, seeds, and pesticides.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert has been practicing farming in Narok for the last 5 years. He is 25 years old, single and supports his parents. He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and is applying for his third loan. He has repaid his first two loans fully and on time. He plans to use this loan to buy maize seeds and fertilizer, and also hire temporary field workers to assist him in planting. In the future, he hopes to become a leading farmer in Narok town.

loans.use: to buy maize seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Jay

texts.en: Jay, 25 years of age, is married and blessed with one child. He is a charcoal vendor in their village. He earns 3,000 monthly in this business. He's asking for a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase materials needed in his charcoal making and selling business, such as firewood. He hopes that Kiva lenders will continue to support his loan and hopes to expand his business further to generate higher profits and sustain his family's daily needs.

loans.use: To purchase firewood to make charcoal to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to plant a new maize crop.

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally is an entrepreneur from the town of Banga, South Cotabato. She is engaged in farming and an eatery business. She primarily grows corn crops to sell. She also cooks the food that she sells at her eatery.

Sally needs fertilizers and raw ingredients like vegetables and oil, for cooking viands to sell at her eatery. She requested a loan to fund her businesses. She will also buy soft drinks for her eatery. Sally works hard to improve her businesses and her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and raw ingredients such as vegetables and oil, and also soft drinks.

loans.name: Albertine

texts.en:
Albertine is 29 years old. She has 3 children who are aged 5-11years old. Her husband sells timber. Albertine sells food stuffs such as rice and sorghum and she has done this business for 5 years. She pays school fees and feeds her family with the profits she makes. 

Albertine is requesting a loan to buy more food stuffs in order to make more profits. She plans to continue meeting the needs of her family with the profits that she hopes to make.

loans.use: Buying food stuffs.

loans.name: Rajabgul

texts.ru: Рачабгул проживает в районе Дангара. Возраст, 48 лет. Замужем, имеет 6 детей. Муж работает в городе Душанбе, а дети еще учатся. Сама Рачабгул занимается торговлей. Она на центральном рынке района занимается продажей женской одежды и обуви. В этой области она работает уже два года. Кредит берет для покупки обуви и рубашек.
texts.en: Rajabgul lives in Dangara. She is 48 years old, married, and has six children. Her husband works in the city of Dushanbe, and her children still go to school. Rajabgul works in trade. She sells women’s clothing and shoes in the city’s central market.  She has been doing this work for two years. She is taking out a loan to buy shoes and shirts.

loans.use: to buy shoes and shirts

loans.name: Janat

texts.en:
Janat lives in Uganda. She is single and has 4 children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (father).    

Janat has a business of a restaurant. She has been in this business for 10 years and she works 7 days out of every week. She sells her products from home, by means of retail.    

Janat has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas, cooking oil, rice, beef and sweet potatoes. She also generates additional income through selling cold drinks. The main business challenges for Janat include defaulters and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are see her business grow big and to own a fully stocked restaurant.   

Janat lives in a home that she owns. She has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of bananas, beef, rice and sweet potatoes.

loans.name: Rose Marilyn

texts.en:
Rose Marilyn is engaged in the farming business. She plants and harvests rice for sale. Rose Marilyn is generating PHP 30,000 during harvest season. She uses her income for the education of her four school-aged children.

At present, Marilyn is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase seeds and fertilizers for her to sustain her business.

In the future, Rose Marilyn hopes to start another business aside from her farming business to earn more income.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 30 years old, married and has four children, all of whom are in school. To make a living, she does mixed farming. She has been in this line of work for more than eight years and earns about 15,000 Kenya shillings a month. She has been a good client of KADET and is applying for her second loan, which she will use to buy farm supplies. This will allow her to grow a variety of crops and improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita, 42 years old, is married to a farmer and blessed with four children. She has been a fruits and vegetables vendor for almost five years. She's asking for a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase additional fruits and vegetables to sell in their public market. She will buy bananas, squash, potatoes, tomatoes and cabbage. Lolita is determined to work hard and to gain more income. She hopes to continue to take loans from ASKI through KIVA lenders so that she can achieve her dreams for her children through patience and hard work.

loans.use: To purchase additional bananas, squash, potatoes, tomatoes and cabbage to sell

loans.name: Eugenio

texts.en: Eugenio, 43 years of age, is married and blessed with four children. Eugenio is engaged in raising hogs. When he sells one hog, his net income is 3,000 PHP every three months. He's asking for a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase feed for his hogs. He hopes that Kiva lenders will continue to support him in the future as he looks to expand his business and eventually start his own new store.

loans.use: To purchase feed for his hogs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Fourbatou

texts.fr: Revendeuse ambulante de pagnes  depuis 2007, Fourbatou est âgée de 35 ans et mère au foyer avec deux enfants. C’est une brave femme qui ne ménage aucun effort pour  apporter sa pierre à l’édifice et contribuer à la bonne éducation de leurs enfants. Ce prêt qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’augmenter son stock et varier le choix dans l’achat des pagnes pour élargir sa clientèle.Elle s'approvisionne sur place.
texts.en: An itinerant retailer of traditional dress since 2007, Fourbatou is 35 years old and a housewife with two children. She is an honest woman who is totally devoted to working hard to make her contribution to the proper education of the couple’s children. The loan that she is requesting will enable her to increase her stock and diversify the choice of cloth to enlarge her clientele. She purchases her stock locally.

loans.use: purchase pagnes for resale .

loans.name: Dominic

texts.en: Dominic is married and has two children.  He grows wheat and raises cattle. He is requesting a loan to buy farm inputs, which would allow him to expand his farming and increase the number of animals. His goal is to work hard to support his family and above all to help his children complete their education.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Theracisse

texts.en:
Theracisse is 45 years old. She has 2 children, aged 16 and 23 years old. They are both in school. She doesn’t stay with her husband. She owns a shop in which she sells sugar, rice, cooking oil, radio cells etc. This business enables her pay house rent, send her children to school and to meet her needs. 

Theracisse is requesting a loan to reinvest in her business by buying more more items such as sugar, rice, etc. She plans to renovate her house with the profits that she plans to make.

loans.use: to buy rice, cooking oil, etc for her shop.

loans.name: Gbenonkpo Dedokpo Group

texts.fr: GBENONKPO DEDOKPO est un groupe de deux personnes, dont les membres habitent dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, Véronique (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est née en 1978 au Bénin. Mariée et mère de deux enfants tous scolarisés, Véronique vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Véronique assure avec son mari les diverses charges de la famille. Il y a près de vingt ans que Véronique fait le commerce du charbon de bois au Bénin. Cette activité l'aide en effet à subvenir à ses besoins, tout en assurant les besoins de ses enfants. C’est la deuxième fois que Véronique et son groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. Véronique  ambitionne dans l'avenir construire sa propre maison.
texts.en: The "Gbenonkpo Dedokpo"  group is composed of two individuals living in the same neighborhood in Benin. The group’s representative, Veronique (raising her hadn in the photo) was born in Benin in 1978. Married and the mother of two children, both in school, Veronique lvies together with her husband and children. Veronique and her husband jointly provide for various family needs. For almost 20 years, Veronique has been selling charcoal. This business activity helps her to support herself and her children. This is the second time that Veronique and her group is seeking financing from ALIDe in order to bolster their working capital and better meet customer demand. Veronique’s goal for the future is to have her own house built.

loans.use: to buy five bags of charcoal

loans.name: Belancille

texts.en:
Belancille is 41 years old. She has 7 children who are between the ages of 6-21 years old. Six of the children are in school. 

Belancilla owns a general store in which she sells a variety of items such as salt, matches, sandals, juices, biscuits, etc. She has done this business for 4 years and she works with her husband. This business supports the well-being of Belancille’s family. She needs a loan to buy more items for her shop such as soap, candles, cooking oil, etc. to make more profits. She plans to buy a goat from the profits that she hopes to make.

loans.use: to buy candles, soap, cooking oil and other items to stock in her store.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina, 33 years of age, is married to a farmer and blessed with three children. She manages a motorcycle transport business together with her husband. They have operated this business for almost two years. Gina earns 3,500 PHP monthly. She's asking for a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase materials such as spare parts needed for the maintenance of their motorcycle. She also plans to purchase some hogs to raise from the income generated from the motorcycle business. She would like to continue taking loans and hopes Kiva lenders will extend their assistance to her in the future.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 34 years old and married with two infant-aged children. Florence is a farmer working in the Philippines. She earns PHP 25,000 every cropping season. 

Florence is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase seeds and other inputs used in farming. Florence has been growing rice for almost eight years.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and other inputs used in farming

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en:
Chantal is 47 years old. She stays with her 6 year old granddaughter. She is separated from her husband. 

Chantal is very hardworking; she sells sorghum. She has sold sorghum for 2 years and her business is going on well. With the profits of her business she built her own family house. She is requesting a loan to buy more sorghum and to make more profits. With the profits, she plans to finish her house because some things are missing in her house.

loans.use: to buy sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Nob Sa Jeker Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité NOB SA JEKER est créé le 12 mai 2010; il est composé de 10 femmes qui sont voisines et mènent la même activité de petit commerce. 


Sokhna la responsable du groupe est âgée de 43 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de dix enfants dont les derniers sont des jumeaux. 

Elle mène une activité de restauration de petit déjeuner café et beignets dans une petite boutique. Elle a une expérience de deux ans dans ce domaine. Elle se ravitaille au marché de la communauté rurale. Sur la photo elle est assise à gauche habillée en boubou bleu blanc et portant un des jumeaux.


Avec son prêt, elle souhaite acheter du café moulu, du sucre et de la farine en grande quantité pour renforcer son activité.


Ses bénéfices lui permettent de subvenir à ses besoins mais aussi d'aider son mari dans les dépenses de la famille pour un mieux bien être des enfants.
texts.en:
The Nob Sa Jeker solidarity group was created on May 12, 2010; it is composed of 10 women who are neighbors and all have the same line of work as vendors. SOkhna’s, the group’s leader, is 43 years old. She is married and the mother of 10 children, the two youngest being twins. She prepares food for sale in a small shop: breakfast dishes, coffee and beignets. She has two years of experience in this filed. She stocks up at the local rural market. On the photo, she is seated to the left wearing a white and blue outfit and holding one of her twins.

With her loan, she plans to buy large quantities of ground coffee, sugar and flour in order to strengthen her business. Her income allows her to provide for her own needs and also to help her husband support the household and ensure a better quality of life for her children.

loans.use: to buy coffee and flour for sale.

loans.name: Turakhon

texts.ru: Турахон проживает в районе Дангара. Ему 49 лет. Женат. Имеет 5 детей. Его жена домохозяйка, а дети учатся в средней школе. Сам Турахон имеет высшее образование. По профессии он преподаватель. В этой области проработал более 10 лет. На сегодняшний день он занимается торговлей на рынке. Он арендует торговую точку, где продает мужскую и детскую одежду. Этим видом деятельности занимается 2 года. Кредит берет для покупки сезонного товара. Он хочет увеличить ассортимент своего товара.
texts.en: Turakhon lives in Dangara. He is 49 years old, married, and has five children. His wife is a housewife, and his children study in high school. Turakhon has a higher education. By profession, he is a teacher. He taught for more than ten years. Today, he works trading in the market. He rents a shop where he sells men's and children's clothes. He has been doing this work for two years.  He is taking out a loan to buy seasonal goods. He wants to increase the variety of goods he sells.

loans.use: to buy seasonal goods

loans.name: Vangeline

texts.en:
Vangeline is 35 and is a married woman. She has 3 children. The oldest child is 6. 

Vangeline is a farmer working in Banga, South Cotabato. She has been growing corn and vegetables for 6 and 1/2 years. She earns 10,000 PHP per month doing this farming. 

This loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. In the future, she hopes to improve her farming business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: La Victoire Group

texts.fr: La cliente Pendano est entrepreneur, leader du groupe d’affaire « la Victoire », âgée de 37 ans, mariée, mère de 3 enfants. Son mari est un mécanicien. La cliente est vendeuse de légumes (spécialement du Sombé) au long de la rue ambiante.  Il ya 6 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Elle démarra son business avec  20$ issus de ses revenus de tricotage. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec  20 tas de Sombé frais et le reste sera affecté aux mini projets de ménage.  En plus, elle ambitionne agrandir son entreprise, scolariser ses enfants et  acheter une parcelle pour y construire sa maison.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres exclus de banque classique. Il sied de signaler que le groupe d’affaire « la Victoire » est majoritairement féminins.
texts.en: Pendano is an entrepreneur and the leader of the business group "La Victoire" (Victory). She is 37, married, and a mother of 3. Her husband is a mechanic. She sells vegetables, especially Sombé (cassava leaves), on the street, which she has been doing for 6 years. She started her business with 20$, which she got from knitting. She will use this new loan to buy 20 piles of fresh Sombé and use the rest of the money for other household-related mini-projects. In addition to that, she plans on expanding her business, sending her children to school, and buying a piece of land to build a house. Pendano thanks Hekima for what it does to help those who have been rejected by traditional banks. It should be noted that "La Victoire" is a business group which consists of female members mainly.

loans.use: buy 20 piles of fresh Sombé (cassava leaves)

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Entente Group

texts.fr: ENTENTE est un groupe constitué de trois personnes et dont la représentante (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est nommée Agathe Dossi. Les membres du groupe habitent ensemble dans le même quartier au Bénin. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement, ce groupe sollicite pour la première fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Née le 07 Mars 1966 au Bénin, Agathe Dossi est mariée et mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Agathe Dossi habite ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la famille. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Agathe Dossi fait le commerce des cartes de recharges téléphoniques au Bénin. Agathe Dossi s'approvisionne auprès des grossistes de la place. Ce premier prêt permettra certainement à Agathe Dossi et à son groupe de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu.
texts.en: The Entente Group is composed of three individuals. Its representative (the one raising her hand in the photo) is called Agathe Dossi. The group members live in the same neighborhood in Benin. With the goal of increasing their business capital, the group members are seeking their first loan from ALIDé. Born on March 7, 1966 in Benin, Agathe Dossi is married and the mother of three children, all of whom are in school. Agathe Dossi lives together with her husband and children. The spouses jointly provide for various family needs. In order to support herself and the children, Agathe Dossi sells recharge cellular  cards in Benin. She stocks up from local wholesalers. This first loan will certainly allow Agathe Dossi and her group to expand the level of their activities, and to increase the number of customers as well as the revenues.

loans.use: to buy phone cards

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 50 and is a married woman. She has 4 children. The oldest child is 32. She and her husband are both farmers. They primarily grow corn crops to sell. Zenaida also runs a sari-sari store business. She sells biscuits, sugar, noodles and various other products.

Zenaida's loan will be used to buy fertilizers and more items to sell such as canned goods and bread. She hopes to start another business in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and more items to sell such as canned goods and bread.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Wanting to assist her husband provide their family needs, Melanie is also doing her best managing their farming business. At the age of 46, she now has two school-aged children. With that, Melanie's determination to improve their living standard increased.

To have a large crop of rice, Melanie is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pesticides. She knows that with this loan, she will have a bountiful harvest. At present, Melanie is earning PHP 25,000 per harvest. In the future, Melanie wants to double her income.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is married and 45 years old. She has a retail shop where she sells a variety of products like shampoo, soap, canned goods and some daily needs in every day life. Mary Ann has had this business for 15 years.

Mary Ann is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase drinks and cooking ingredients to sell. Each month, Mary Ann earns about PHP 3,000 from her selling business.

In the future, Mary Ann hopes that her business will improve to be able to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase drinks and cooking ingredients to sell

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 55 years old and married. She has a retail shop where she sells different kinds of commodities such as biscuits, soft drinks and canned goods. Rosalinda has had this business for 10 years. According to Rosalinda, her husband is helping her manage the business. Rosalinda still wants to expand her business further.

Rosalinda is requesting a loan amount of PHP 20,000 to buy groceries such as canned goods, sugar, condiments, oils, biscuits and soft drinks. Each month, Rosalinda earns about PHP 5,000 from her business.

In the future, Rosalinda hopes to expand her store so that she can increase her profit.

loans.use: to buy groceries such as canned goods, sugar, condiments, oils, biscuits and soft drinks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase a motorcycle to use as a motorcycle  taxi .

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret  lives in Uganda. She is single and has 3 children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (mother, niece and nephew).    

Margaret has a business of selling paper. She has been in this business for 8 years and she works 6 days out of every week. Margaret sells her products from home, by means of wholesale and retail. Margaret has requested a loan of 1,200,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more boxes of paper and paper glue. The main business challenges for Margaret include seasonality and the ever increasing prices of paper. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to buy a plot of land on which to build rental houses and also to get a permanent business premise.   

Margaret lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of paper and paper glue.

loans.name: Yelian 1 Group

texts.fr: YELIAN 1 est un groupement constitué de onze personnes et dont la présidente (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est nommée Cathérine. Les membres du groupe résident tous dans le même quartier au Bénin. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement, ce groupement sollicite pour la première fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Née en 1965 au Bénin, Cathérine vit depuis dix neuf ans dans une ville du Bénin avec sa famille. Cathérine est en effet mariée à un entrepreneur du nom de Romain et a quatre enfants, qui sont tous  scolarisés. Seulement, un des enfants reste à la charge de Cathérine et de son mari. Le couple subvient ensemble aux besoins de la famille. Cathérine n'a jamais été à l'école. Depuis environs dix huit ans, Cathérine vend des bambous à son domicile. Cette activité lui génère des revenus l'aidant à contribuer aux dépenses familiales. Cathérine s'approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Ce premier prêt permettra certainement à Cathérine et à son groupe de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu.
texts.en:
YELIAN 1 is a group composed of eleven people whose president (the one with her hand raised in the photo) goes by the name of Cathérine. The group members all reside in the same district, in Benin. With the goal of increasing their working capital, this group is requesting a loan from ALIDé for the first time.

Born in 1965 in Benin, Cathérine has been living for nine years in a city in Benin with her family. She is actually married to an entrepreneur by the name of Romain, and she has four children, who are all educated. Only one of the children remains in their care. The couple jointly supports the needs of the family.

Cathérine never attended school. For about eighteen years, she has been selling bamboo out of her house. This business generates revenues for her that helps her to do her part to cover family expenses. She gets her supplies in a city in Benin. 

This initial loan will certainly enable her and her group to boost their level of business and to increase their customer base and their revenues.

loans.use: to buy bamboo

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is from Uganda. She is married and has 5 children, two of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (grand children). 

Margaret has a business of selling charcoal. She has been in this business for 9 years and she works 6 days out of every week. Margaret sells her products from home, by means of wholesale. 

Margaret has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. She also generates additional income through selling piped water. The main business challenges for Margaret include seasonality and transportation. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to buy a plot of land on which to build rental houses and to own a delivery van.   

Margaret lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is a 54-year-old married woman living in the village of Villa Norte Maddela Quirino. Angelita has two children who already have their own family. Angelita’s spouse works as a welder.

She earns about PHP 2,500 per month doing this kind of business. Angelita has operated this welding shop for 25 years. Angelita is requesting a loan of PHP 13,000 to purchase materials needed in her welding shop such as metals.

In the future, Angelita hopes to improve her business through taking additional loans from ASKI through the KIVA lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed for her welding shop

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita is 50 years old and married. She has a retail shop where she sells a variety of products like shampoo, soap, cooking ingredients and other daily needs. Estelita has had this business for five years.

Estelita is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase shampoo, soap, cooking ingredients and canned goods to sell. Each month, Estelita earns about PHP 3,000 in her selling business.

In the future, Estelita hopes that her business will improve and she will be able to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase shampoo, soap, cooking ingredients and canned goods to sell

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Djekafo est un regroupement de quatre femmes mariées qui ont en moyenne 49 ans, 5 enfants et  qui vivent dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Fana, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de fruits, de condiments alimentaires et d’habits.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe Djekafo sont à leur onzième prêt solidaire et les dix précédents ont tous été remboursés sans aucune difficulté.                                                                        
La cliente AWA compte acheter des fruits et des tubercules avec les revendeurs du marché de Fana. Elle effectue ses ventes sur place dans la ville de Fana au bord du goudron, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 25 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
Djekafo is a group of four married women who have an average age of 49 and, on average, five children, and who live in traditional extended families in the town of Fana, prefecture of Dioïla, Koulikoro Region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). 

They came to know each other through being related, or as neighbors or friends. They sell fruit, condiments, and clothing. They are on their 11th solidarity loan, and the ten preceding ones were reimbursed with no difficulty. 
                                                                        
Our client by the name of Awa intends to buy fruit and yams from the sellers at the market of Fana. She resells her merchandise right in Fana along the highway, for cash or credit, to a clientele composed of men and women. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 25,000 F CFA which will be used to make payments on the loan and to pay her share of social ceremonies, with the rest being invested in her business.

loans.use: to buy fruit and yams.

loans.name: Hadjah

texts.en:
Hadjah lives in Uganda. She is married and has 8 children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (in-laws).  

Hadjah has a business of selling local gin. She has been in this business for 5 years and she works 6 days out of every week. Hadjah sells her products from home, by means of wholesale.   

Hadjah has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more jerrycans of local gin. The main business challenges for Hadjah include seasonality and transportation. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a wholesale shop and to own a delivery van.   

Hadjah lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more jerrycans of local gin.

loans.name: Juboo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Juboo du Banc villageois de Ndiongué est créé le 12 mai 2010; il est composé de quinze femmes issues du même village et ont les mêmes activités (petit commerce et embouche ovine).



La responsable Fatou est âgée de 31 ans, elle est veuve et a sept enfants en charge dont deux de sa coépouse. Elle s'active depuis quatre ans dans le petit commerce de poisson fumé et d'huile et fait parallèlement de l'embouche ovine. Elle s'approvisionne au marché hebdomadaire et vend dans le village. Sur la photo elle est à gauche habillée en mauve avec un châle blanc et a levé la main droite.


Son prêt lui permettra de renforcer sa capacité de vente pour se faire plus de revenus.


Elle a la charge de toutes les dépenses familiales mais souhaite avec ses bénéfices augmenter son épargne.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Juboo of the Banc Villageois of Ndiongué was established on May 12, 2010. It is comprised of fifteen women from the same village who have the same occupation (small-scale commerce and the fattening of sheep).  

Fatou, aged 31, is the group’s official. She is a widow and has seven children to support. Two of the children belong to her co-wife. Fatou has been active for four years in a small business selling smoked fish and oil. At the same time, she fattens sheep. She gets her supplies at the weekly market and makes her sales in the village. In the photo, she is the one at the left raising her right hand. She is dressed in mauve and wearing a white shawl.

Her loan will enable her to bolster her sales capacity, so as to bring in more revenue.  

She is responsible for all family expenses but would like to use her profits to increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy peanuts and smoked fish to be sold

loans.name: Sop Sa Serigne Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Sop Sa Serigne du Banc Villageois de Ndiongué est composé de quatorze femmes qui sont du même village; elles ont le culte du travail; font du petit commerce et la transformation d'huile d'arachide.


Ngaya est âgée de 41 ans,elle est mariée mère de deux enfants; c'est la responsable du groupe.Elle fait du petit commerce et de la transformation d'huile. Elle achète ses produits dans les marchés hebdomadaires et vend dans le village. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine depuis cinq ans. Sur la photo elle est à gauche et tient un cahier et un livret dans sa main et couverte d'un châle noir.


Elle souhaite avec son prêt acheter des marchandises pour renforcer son commerce.

Elle aide son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes. Avec ses bénéfices, elle compte augmenter son épargne.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Sop Sa Serigne of the Banc Villageois of Ndiongué is comprised of fourteen women who are from the same village; they are religious about their work in small-scale commerce and in the processing of peanut oil.

Ngaya is 41 years old, married, and the mother of two children. She is the group’s official. She has a small business for producing oil. She makes her purchases at the weekly markets and sells in the village. She has good experience in this domain over five year's time. In the photo, she is the person at the left holding a notebook and booklet in her hand and wearing a black shawl.

She would like to use her loan to buy some merchandise for bolstering her business.  She assists her husband with day-to-day expenses. With the profits, she plans on increasing her savings.

loans.use: to buy peanuts and beans to be sold

loans.name: Watty

texts.en:
Watty is 41 years old. She lives with her husband and their four children in Cilincing, Jakarta, Indonesia.

Every day, she sells nasi uduk to get income. Nasi uduk is a rice with a unique flavor.

She requested 10,000,000 Indonesian rupiah to buy rice to produce more nasi uduk than she usually does. The income that she makes is used to pay their children's school fees. She also hopes she can send her husband to be a laborer in Brunei so that he can help their family to create more income and it can be used to send their children to school.

loans.use: to buy rice to produce nasi uduk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more bags of charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercidita is a married woman and 38 years old with five school-aged children. Mercidita has a retail shop where she sells different products in the community.

Mercidita is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy bread, soft drinks, canned goods and noodles to sell in the community. Each month, Mercidita earns about PHP 4,000 from her selling business.

In the future, Mercidita hopes that her business will improve so that she can sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy bread, soft drinks, canned goods and noodles to sell

loans.name: Remy

texts.en:
Remy is 44 years old and married. Her family is residing in the village of Villa Norte Maddela Quirino. Remy has three children who are already married.

Remy is engaged in a manicure and pedicure business where she earns PHP 1,500 per month. Aside from this, she also sells food snacks in their village where she generates at least PHP 3,000 a month. According to Remy, those businesses have been very beneficial to supporting her family's expenditures.

Though her businesses are running smoothly, Remy still aims to improve it. Thus, she is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase nail polish and other materials needed in her manicure and pedicure business.

loans.use: to purchase nail polish and other materials needed in her manicure and pedicure business

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 45 years old and live in West Point. She is married to a security officer and they have five children between the ages of 12 and 25. One of their children is working.
For the past year, Joyce has been running a little restaurant where she sells African dishes. She make a lot of profit since she has a lot of customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase rice, oil and fish for her business. In the future, she plans to educate her children and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase rice, oil and fish for her business.

loans.name: Berna

texts.en:
Berna is married and has five children, all of whom are in school. She lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food for the family.
Berna has a retail shop business. She has been in this business for over ten years, and works six days a week. Berna has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of sugar, boxes of soap, cooking oil and crates of soda. She also generates additional income through rental rooms.|The main business challenge(s) for Berna include seasonality, transportation and thieves. Her business goals and aspirations are to own a wholesale shop and a delivery van.

loans.use: to buy more bags of sugar, boxes of soap, cooking oil and crates of beer.

loans.name: Bayansaikhan

texts.en:
Bayansaikhan is a 40-year-old widow and lives with her two sons and two daughters, aged between 1 and 21. The family lives in Mongolia's capital, Ulaanbaatar, in an apartment. Bayansaikhan's oldest son works as a dancer in the countryside while her youngest son and oldest daughter attend public school. Bayansaikhan’s mother is retired and cares for Bayansaikhan’s youngest daughter. 

Bayansaikhan supports her children by operating two retail stalls at Narantuul, the largest outdoor market in Mongolia. When she first began her business in 2000, she sold TV antennas at her one stall. Today she sells TV antennas and telecontrols at her two retail stalls and she has 3’000’000 Mongolian Tugriks (MNT) in working capital. She said: “I want to support my children's education and their lives by working hard”. She is applying for a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase more TV antennas and telecontrols from Ereen, the border city of China, so that she can sell more to her customers during this very busy shopping season.

loans.use: to purchase more TV antennas and telecontrols

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase caustic soda and oil for her business.

loans.name: Lucina

texts.en:
Lucina is a 47-year-old married woman living in Dodan, Peñablanca, Cagayan. Lucina has been in the business of hog raising for two years. She is also engaged in rice selling. She earns approximately PHP 5,000 monthly from her businesses. She is requesting a loan of PHP 4,000 to purchase hog feed and other supplies.

In the future, Lucina would like to make frequent sales and consistent profits to make her family more economically stable.

loans.use: to purchase hog feed and other supplies

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en: Hawa is 46 years old and live in West Point. She has two children aged 25 and 30. Only one of them attends school. For the past seven years Hawa has been selling traditional cloth (lappa) in the local market. She enjoys her work there. She is requesting a loan to purchase more lappa for her business; she plans to buy some land and build a house on it in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more Lappa (a traditional cloth) for her business.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 53 years old and married. She has a retail shop where she sells different kinds of products like garlic, vinegar, soft drinks, oils, milk, diapers, shampoo and soap.

Rosalinda has had this business for three years. According to her, she would like to improve her store by buying additional groceries. But due to insufficient funds, she is requesting a loan of PHP 19,000 to buy additional groceries such as soft drinks, oils, sugar, canned goods and baked breads. Rosalinda usually earns PHP 4,200 a month in this business.

In the future, Rosalinda hopes to buy a larger stock of groceries to minimize her transportation expenses going to and from the market. She is praying that she can avail this loan amount.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell such as soft drinks, oils, sugar, canned goods and baked breads

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase 30 gallons of oil for her business.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is 31 years old and single. He runs a retail shop where he sells sugar, cooking fat, tea leaves, salt and soap. Besides this business, he is also employed. Joseph was previously selling clothes to earn a living. He has sustained his business for one and a half years because of his good customer care skills. His dream is to own rental houses in the future. He has requested a loan of 80,000 KES to buy sugar, rice, maize flour, cooking fat and diapers for his store.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, maize flour, cooking fat and diapers for his store.

loans.name: Sabatoe

texts.en: Sabatoe is 33 years old and lives in West Point. He is married and is a high school dropout. His wife is a businesswoman. For the past nine years, Sabatoe has been selling ladies' and gents' clothes, shoes and bags. During the rainy season his sales are very low. He is requesting a loan to purchase more shoes and bags for his business. He plans to send his children to quality schools in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more shoes and bags for his business.

loans.name: Teo

texts.en:
Teo lives in Uganda.  She is married and has three children, all of whom attend school.  Teo runs a retail shop.  She has been in this business for seven years and works six days a week. Teo sells her products in a shop, by means of retail.  She is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of sugar, boxes of soap, and cooking oil.  

The main business challenges for Teo include seasonality, transportation, and thieves.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a wholesale shop and also to build her own rental house.  Teo lives in a home which she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of sugar, boxes of soap, and cooking oil

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 39 years old, married and has four children. For ten years, she has been farming. She practises mixed farming, which includes growing coffee and rearing pigs and cows. Through Kiva partner, Faulu Kenya, she has managed to add dairy cows to her farm. Rose hopes to become a successful farmer in the future. She sees herself becoming financially stable within five years. Rose has requested a loan of 80,000 KES to buy animal feed and a dairy cow.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and a dairy cow.

loans.name: Albertha

texts.en:
Albertha is 38 years old and lives in Logan Town. She’s married and has five children. Her husband is a businessman and all of their children attend school.

Albertha has been running a movie center where she shows beautiful African, European and American movies among others, and due to this she has a lot of customers.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more DVDs for her business. She plans to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more DVDs for her business.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 44 years old and married with three children.  To earn a living, he sells school uniforms.  He has been engaged in the business for nineteen years.  He also sells mobile phone airtime cards.  

He says that since he joined Faulu Kenya, his lifestyle has improved and he has gained confidence as the chairman of his group, which is registered under Faulu Kenya.  

He has requested 80,000 KES from Faulu Kenya.  He will use the loan to buy mobile phone airtime cards and fabric for making uniforms.

loans.use: to buy fabric for making uniforms and mobile phone airtime cards.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy utensils, shoes and clothes.

loans.name: Kondoa Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth is in her early 30s, single, and has two children, both of whom attend school. She has been a food vendor for 10 years. She works form 6.00 pm to 11.00 pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Elizabeth's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase her food stock and for household expenses and has repaid all her loans successfully.  She is requesting a new loan to increase her food stock. Her dream is to one day buy some land.

Elizabeth will share this loan with her loan group, "Kondoa," which has 15 members who hold each other accountable in repaying the loan.

loans.use: To increase her food stock.

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia is 48 years old and widowed with one child.  She grows cereals such as beans, maize and peas to earn a living. She has been in the business for only one year.  She was previously selling kerosene and secondhand clothes.  Her hard work has helped her to sustain her business. 

Teresia is determined to buy a piece of land so that she can build a decent house.  She has requested 50,000 KES to buy farm fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy farm fertilizer.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty, a widowed mother of six children, all of whom are in school, lives in Uganda where she has operated a business selling clothes for the past seven years, working six days a week. Betty, who sells her products in a shop, has requested a loan of 1000000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of African attire (bitenge).  Betty’s business challenges includes seasonality, transportation and thieves.  Her goals and aspirations are to own a wholesale shop and to build her own rental house.

Betty lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food for the family.

loans.use: to buy more African attire.

loans.name: Conchellah

texts.en:
Concellah is 34 years old and married with five children.  He runs a retail shop to earn a living.  He really values his family and he works hard to meet their needs. 

He joined Faulu Kenya after being introduced by a friend, and since then he has a lot of hope for his business because he can access loans easily.  He hopes that one day he will expand his business into wholesale.  

He needs 50,000 KES to buy sugar, rice, soap and cooking fat.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, soap and cooking fat.

loans.name: Abel

texts.en: Abel is 37 years old and married with three children.  He runs a boutique to earn a living.  He started the business four years ago.  He has sustained his business because he learned how to manage his business by keeping business records. He thanks Faulu Kenya for training him on business record keeping.  He hopes that someday he will build an apartment.  He needs 50,000 KES to buy clothes.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Abu

texts.en:
Abu is 32 years old and lives in the New Kru Area. He’s married and has three children between the ages of 9 and 18, all of whom live at home and attend school.

For the past five years Abu has been selling ladies' and gents' wear (shoes, slippers, jeans and T shirts) in the local market. He enjoys his business because he makes a lot of money. 

He’s requesting a loan to purchase more ladies' and gents' wear for his business. He plans to educate his children and build a house for them.

loans.use: to purchase more ladies' and gents' wear for his business.

loans.name: Walter

texts.en: Walter is a 24-year-old business man.  He is married and blessed with a one-year-old child.  He was previously selling clothes before he started a hardware shop.  It's one year since he started the business.  He hopes to grow his business in the future.  He has requested 50,000 KES to buy paints, iron sheets, nails and cement.

loans.use: to buy paints, iron sheets, nails and cement.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 35 years old and married with two children.  She has been operating a salon for eleven years.  She also depends on her husband, who is a farmer, for financial support.  She was previously selling cereals to earn a living.  

She joined Faulu Kenya so that she could access financial resources easily.  She has managed to add business stock with her previous loan from Faulu Kenya.  

Janet has requested 50,000 KES to buy a hair steamer and hair braids.

loans.use: to buy a hair steamer and hair braids.

loans.name: Genoviv

texts.en:
Genoviv is a 39-year-old married woman living in Dodan, Peñablanca, Cagayan. Genoviv has two children. Genoviv's spouse works as a tricycle driver. 
Genoviv has been in the business of hog raising for one year and earns approximately PHP 3,000 monthly. She is requesting a loan of PHP 4,000 to purchase building materials such as blocks, cement and sand to improve her pigpen. In the future, Genoviv would like to enhance her hog raising business and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase building materials such as blocks, cement and sand to improve her pigpen.

loans.name: Korotoumou

texts.fr:
Née le 15- 03 -1976 à Bamako, Madame Korotoumou est mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle vit avec son mari  et ses enfants dans le quartier Darsalam II de la ville  de Koutiala (Région de Sikasso).  Dû à des problèmes de famille, elle a prématurément abandonnée l’école pour s’adonner aux  activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat vente de tissus, pagnes wax, brodés et autres depuis 18 ans auprès de sa maman.  Sa notoriété est bonne car elle reçoit des commandes à travers des associations féminines lors des cérémonies et surtout à l’approche des fêtes.  
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus importante, elle décida de rejoindre  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso.  Elle est à son premier prêt individuel.  
Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt, 10 pièces de pagnes wax et diverses autres sortes de tissus à Bamako. Korotoumou est ambulante et effectue sa vente dans les différentes structures professionnelles de Koutiala et à son domicile, à une clientèle constituée de femmes et d’hommes, au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle compte sur un bénéfice mensuel de 80.000FCFA qu’elle  envisage utiliser pour le remboursement des taux d’intérêts de Soro Yiriwaso, subvenir aux besoins familiaux et élargir son activité avec le reste. 
Très ambitieuse, Madame Korotoumou a pour perspective d’ouvrir une boutique de vente de tissus et d’autres produits au grand marché de Koutiala.
texts.en:
Born on March 15,1976 in Bamako, Madame Korotoumou is married and the mother of four children. She lives with her husband and children in the Darsalam II neighborhood of the town of Koutiala (Sikasso Region).  Due to family problems, she left school early to get into money-earning ventures, particularly buying and selling cloth, "wax"-style African print cloth, embroidered cloth and so on for 18 years, working with her mother. She is well known as she receives orders through women's associations to mark ceremonies and especially at the holiday season. 

In order to satisfy the needs of her ever growing clientele, she decided to join the Microfinance Institution Soro Yiriwaso. She is on her first individual loan. 

With this loan she expects to buy 10 lengths of "wax" cloth, as well as various other sorts of cloth, in Bamako. She works as a itinerant salesperson, making her sales in various professional circles in Koutiala and out of her home, to a clientele made up of women and men, for cash and on credit. 

She expects to make a monthly profit of 80,000 F CFA which she intends to use to reimburse Soro Yiriwaso's interest, to support her family, expanding her business with any remainder.  

Very ambitious, Madame Korotoumou would like in future to open up a little shop to sell cloth and other items in the big open-air market of Koutiala.

loans.use: to buy lengths of African cloth for resale.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr:
Madame Aminata est née vers 1957 à Yorosso, mariée mère  de 4 enfants, elle vit dans une famille monogame avec son époux et ses enfants dans le quartier Darsalam I de la préfecture de Koutiala (région de Sikasso). 
Pour des raisons sociales, Aminata n’a pas eu la chance de faire des études et elle s’est vite intéressée aux activités génératrices de revenus, depuis à bas âge, auprès de sa maman. Après avoir exercé plusieurs activités sans réussite, elle finit par opter pour l’achat vente des bois de construction et des bois de chauffe  il y a 15 ans. Madame Aminata trouve que cette activité lui procure assez de revenus, car elle vend une importante quantité de bois dans le mois.  
Pour la bonne satisfaction de sa clientèle en quantité et augmenter la taille de son activité, elle décida de  faire recours à  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a 6 ans. Après 8 prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe) tous remboursés correctement, elle est à son 3 eme  prêt  individuel  et les deux précédents ont été correctement payé.   
Avec ce nouveau, elle compte acheter, 1 chargement de remorque en bois dans un  village de Koutiala  et  elle effectue sa vente  dans le marché de Koutiala  à une clientèle mixte, au comptant.  
Avec ce prêt elle compte  réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 90.000FCFA par mois qu’elle envisage utiliser pour le remboursement des intérêts, participer aux dépenses quotidiennes de la famille et investir le reste dans son activités. Elle compte sur les financements  de Soro  Yiriwaso pour l’agrandissement de son activité.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aminata was born in about 1957 at Yorosso, she is married and mother of 4 children.She lives in a monogamous family with her husband and children in the neighborhood Darsalam 1 of the Koutiala prefecture (Sikasso region).
For social reasons, Aminata was not lucky enough to study and she rapidly became interested in income generating activities at a young age at her mother’s side. Having practiced several activities without success, she finally chose the commerce of building timber and firewood 15 years ago. Mrs. Aminata finds that this activity brings in sufficient income for she sells a considerable amount of wood each month.
To satisfy her customers’ need for quantity and to enlarge the size of her business, she decided to consult the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance organization 6 years ago. After 8 solidarity loans (group loans), all correctly repaid, this is her 3 rd. individual loan, the two previous loans have been repaid correctly.
With this new loan, she intends to purchase, 1 trailer load of wood in the village of Koutiala, she sells her merchandise at the market in Koutiala to a mixed clientele for cash.
With this loan she hopes to make an average profit of 90.000FCFA per month which she plans to use for the repayment of the interest, for contributing to the family expenses and the remainder she will re-invest in her business. She is counting on the funding of Soro Yiriwaso for the expansion of her activity.

loans.use: purchase wood for construction.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more fish.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is 42 years old and married. She has a retail shop where she sells different kinds of baked breads, oils, soap and some daily needs of her co-villagers. Amelita has had this business for almost 17 years. According to her, she would like to expand her store to generate more income. Aside from expanding her store, she aims to buy more products needed within the village. 

Amelita is requesting a loan of PHP 17,000 to purchase additional groceries such as canned goods, soft drinks, sugar and coffee. Each month, Amelita earns about PHP 4,000 doing this business.

In the future, Amelita hopes to maintain and expand her business for her to continue to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries such as canned goods, soft drinks, sugar and coffee

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en:
Ricardo is a 41-year-old married man living in Malibabag, Peñablanca, Cagayan. Ricardo has three children. Ricardo's spouse works as a domestic helper. He has been in the business of motorcycle transport services for seven years and he earns approximately PHP 5,000 monthly. He plans to use this loan to pay for his license and for the repair of his motorcycle for better service.

In the future, Ricardo would like to have good financial management and make his family more economically stable.

loans.use: to pay for his license and to repair his motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy vegetables and green maize.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 42-year-old married man with seven children living in his own semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is the sole provider for the family and his dream is to set up a farm. For two years he has been operating a retail shop and this has helped him provide the basics for his family. He started with 100,000 shillings and currently he has working capital of 2,500,000 shillings. He has the challenge of irregular sales due to inflation. His desire is to become a wholesale trader. John needs this loan to buy maize, sugar and soap to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize flour, sugar and soap to sell.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en: Gabriel is a member of Faulu Kenya under the Gakuya group.  He has benefited from Faulu Kenya through the group because he is able to access business loans and because the members of the group guarantee each other's loans.  He has managed to improve his business, where he sells items like caps, balls, diaries and notebooks.  He needs 40,000 KES to buy seat covers, caps and mats.  Gabriel hopes to own a permanent business premises in the future.

loans.use: to buy seat covers, caps and mats.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sodas, baking flour and cooking fat.

loans.name: Lusya

texts.en:
Lusya is 57 years old, and she lives in Vanadzor with her husband. Six years ego Lusya transformed one of her home’s rooms into a shop, where she has been running a general store all these years. Her husband helps her in her occupation and together they solve their family’s needs. 

She has separated part of her shop for selling household goods, which she intends to enlarge. For that addition, she is asking for a 1,000,000 AMD loan to buy shampoos, washing powders, soaps and other merchandise for her household goods department, and also to buy foodstuffs for her food section.

loans.use: to buy shampoos, washing powders, soaps, and other household goods and also foodstuffs for her shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Zephaniah

texts.en:
Zephaniah is 30 years old, married, and the father of two.  He is able to provide for his family with the income from his electronics repair shop.  He repairs electronics such as TVs, radios and computers.  

He was previously employed and decided to go into business for himself because he needed to earn enough income to raise his family.  His desire is to expand his business.  

He has requested 30,000 KES to buy transistors, speakers, motherboards and TV kits.

loans.use: to buy transistors, speakers, motherboards and TV kits.

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne is 34 years old and a member of the Uplift Self-Help group under Faulu Kenya.  She runs a business with the name of Comfort Car Hire, where she hires out cars. She has employed one person.  She is also a marketer by profession.  She was previously supplying construction materials to earn a living.  

She has realized that she has improved her business with the skills she gained through the trainings conducted by Faulu Kenya.  She hopes to own more cars in the future.  

With 20,000 KES, she will service her cars.

loans.use: to service her cars.

loans.name: Katagbotma Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Katagbotma” group. They are small scale businesspeople based in Waterloo, a small town in western Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve on their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Abdulai. He is age 49. He was born in a village call Koya, but he is currently residing in Waterloo with his wife and four children. His wife is a trader and his children are attending primary school and secondary schools. 

For fifteen years now, Abdulai has been selling cassava roots, potatoes, gari (fast food made out of cassava roots), etc.  With this loan, Abdulai is going to buy the above mentioned items in bulk to add to his business.

loans.use: to buy cassava roots, potatoes, gari, etc. in bulk.

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
Karine was born in 1959. She lives in Ijevan city with her son, daughter-in-law and her two grandchildren. Karine works in a military unit as a cook, and at the same time she is engaged in pig breeding and beekeeping. Her son helps her a lot in these businesses. Karine says that beekeeping is very laborious, though it’s a very interesting business.
 
Thanks to profit from her beekeeping and pig breeding, Karine keeps her family, and she was able to organize her three children’s weddings. She also bought necessary furniture for her home. 

Karine asks for an 800,000 AMD loan to buy some beehives, some piglets and fodder for her farm animals. This is Karine’s 6th loan from Nor Horizon and her 2nd loan from Kiva.

loans.use: to buy beehives, piglets and fodder.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a welding machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy hair braids.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline is 33 years old, married, and blessed with an eight-year-old child.  She hires cars to earn a living.  She has been in the business for ten years.  She also supplies cheese to supplement her income.  Previously, she was selling clothes to earn a living.  She appreciates Faulu Kenya because she has learned to save her money.  Her desire is to own a tour firm in the future.  She has requested 20,000 KES to service her cars.

loans.use: To service her cars

loans.name: Gangamala Group

texts.en:
