Shabani, in his mid 20's, is single with a 2-year-old child. He has been a tailor for six years, working from 7:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. daily. He is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Shabani's 4th loan from Tujujenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans for household expenses and material for his business. He has repaid his loans successfully. He hopes for a loan to buy material for his tailoring business. His dream is to one day own a food shop and a big place for tailoring.

Shabani will share this loan with his group "Gangamala" which totals 15 members, who will hold each other accountable in repaying their loans.

loans.use: To buy more materials for tailoring.

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en: Damaris is 27 years old and married.  She operates a drug store.  She also sells cosmetics to earn extra income.  She has four years of experience in the business and she has employed one person.  She has grown her shares in Faulu Kenya and this has helped her to get loans.  She used her previous loan to boost her business.  In five years, she hopes to own other outlets of her business in other towns.  She has requested 20,000 KES to buy medicine and cosmetics.

loans.use: To buy medicine and cosmetics

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a large quantity of construction building materials to add to his shop

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en: Dorothy is 32 years old and single.  She operates a cafeteria to earn a living.  She has operated the business for two years.  She joined Faulu Kenya because she needed a financial institution where she would save her money and access loans easily.  She managed to use her previous loan to boost her business.  She hopes to grow her business in the future.  She has requested 10,000 KES to buy ingredients such as maize flour.

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as maize flour

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy food items like rice and groundnuts, and use the remainder to buy a freezer and a generator for her College

loans.name: Begg Sa Yaay Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Begg Sa Yaay est créé le 12 mai 2010; il est composé de neuf femmes qui sont parentes et habitent le même quartier; leur principale activité est le petit commerce.



Madame Anta la responsable du groupe est âgée de 64 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de dix enfants en charge dont trois petits enfants. 

Elle possède une boutique où elle vend divers produits et du pain que lui fourni une boulangerie de la place; elle mène cette activité depuis 40 ans et fait aussi de l'embouche.Sur la photo elle est debout à droite habillée en boubou jaune bleu et couverte d'un châle noir.


Elle souhaite avec son prêt acheter de la marchandise et des moutons pour renforcer ses activités.



Avec ses bénéfices elle compte soutenir ses enfants pour leur réussite sociale.
texts.en: The solidarity group Begg Sa Yaay was created on May 12, 2010; it is comprised of nine women who are parents living in the same district. Their main occupation is small-scale commerce. Ms. Anta, the group's official, is 64 years old, married, and the mother of ten children to support. They include three grandchildren. She has a shop where she sells a variety of goods and bread, which is provided by a local bakery; she has been in this business for forty years. She also fattens livestock. Anta is the one standing in the photo at the right; she is dressed in a yellow and blue boubou and wrapped in a black shawl. Anta would like to use her loan to buy some merchandise and a few heads of sheep for bolstering her work. With the profits, she intends to support her children for their success in society.

loans.use: to buy various foods and some bread to be sold

loans.name: Sop Serigne Mansour Sy Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Sop Serigne Mansour est créé le 10 mai 2010. Il est composé de 22 femmes qui font les mêmes activités de petit commerce et d'embouche bovine. 


Madame Ngoné la responsable est âgée de 30 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants, elle mène une activité d'embouche ouvine depuis dix ans; elle achète ses moutons au marché central du village et les revend là bas. Elle est debout à droite sur la photo habillée de wax jaune sombre.



Son prêt lui permettra de renforcer son activité en achetant plus de moutons et de foin afin de gagner plus de revenus.


Elle souhaite avec les bénéfices réaliser soutenir ses enfants dans leurs divers besoins et gérer le quotidien.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Sop Serigne Mansour was created on May 10, 2010. It is comprised of 22 women who have the same occupation working in small-scale commerce and in the fattening of livestock.

Ms. Ngoné, the group's leader, is 30 years old, married, and the mother of three children. She has been running a business fattening sheep for ten years. She purchases her sheep at the central market of the village and resells them there. She is the one standing at the right in the photo and dressed in a deep yellow Wax cloth. 

Her loan will enable her to bolster her business by buying more sheep and fodder in order to earn more income. She would like to use her profits to meet her children's various needs and to manage the day-to-day.

loans.use: to buy sheep for fattening and then selling

loans.name: Sop Souleye Seck Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Sop Souléye est créé le 12 mai 2010; il est composé de huit femmes qui sont des voisines et peuvent se rencontrer facilement avant les réunions mensuelles.Elles ont pour activité principale le petit commerce

Madame Khoudia la responsable a trois enfants en charge; elle a une expérience moyenne de son activité qu'elle mène depuis un an mais elle est très dynamique. Elle s'approvisionne en huile, poivre, ail, bouillon etc.... dans les grandes boutiques et revend dans le village. Sur la photo elle est à droite habillée en bleu.


Son prêt lui permettra d'augmenter ses produits et de diversifier ses marchandises en achetant des habits et chaussures pour gagner plus de bénéfices.


Avec les bénéfices réaliser: elle soutient son mari dans les dépenses de la famille et le bien être des enfants.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Sop Souléye was created on May 12, 2010. It is made up of eight women who are neighbors and are able to easily meet before the monthly meetings. Their main activity is retail.

Mrs. Khoudia, the leader, has three children. Her experience in her activity is average; she has been practicing it for a year but she is very dynamic. She gets her supplies such as oil, pepper, garlic, and broth in large stores and resells them in her village.  She is on the right of the photo dressed in blue.

Her loan will allow her to increase her products and diversify her merchandise by buying clothing and shoes to make more profit.

With the profit she makes she helps her husband with the family’s expenses and contributes to the well being of the children.

loans.use: to purchase food products and various items for retail.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary requested a loan to stock more charcoal to sell. She is 35 years old, married and has five children. Mary sells charcoal and hopes to expand her business with extra profits in the future.

loans.use: to stock more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en: Vivian sells clothes. She is 32 years old, married, with five children. Four of her children go to school. Vivian requested a loan to stock more clothes to sell. She hopes to expand her business with extra profits in the future.

loans.use: to stock more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Green Group

texts.en:
Masali, in his early 30's, is married with one son who attends school. He has been running a mobile phone sales business for 5 years, working from 8:00 a.m. to 9:00 p.m. daily. Masali is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Masali's 2nd motisha loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. A motisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania that allows borrowers with good credit ratings to repay their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term has ended. Masali used the previous loan to increase his phone stock and has repaid it successfully.  He hopes for a loan to buy more mobile phones and phone accessories to sell. His dream is to one day own a big shop where he will have a big stock of phones.

Masali will share this loan with his group "Green", consisting of 7 members, who will hold each other accountable in repaying their loans.

loans.use: To  buy more mobile phones and phone accessories  to sell.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret sells greens. She is 48 years old, married, with eight children. Margret requested a loan to stock more greens to sell. She hopes to expand her business with extra profits in the future.

loans.use: to stock more greens to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients such as cooking fat, sugar, salt and wheat flour.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice sells fish. She is 35 years old and married with four children (three of them go to school). Alice requested a loan to stock more fish to sell. She hopes to expand her business with extra profits in the future.

loans.use: to stock more fish to sell.

loans.name: Liberathe

texts.en: Liberathe is 53 years old. She has two children who are ages 17 and 23 years old. She works with her husband. She owns a general store selling foodstuffs such as rice, cooking oil, salt and kerosene, etc. With this business, she has built a house and installed electricity in her house. It has also enabled her to meet the needs of her family. She is requesting a loan to buy more foodstuffs, such as rice, to put in her store in order to make more profit. With the profit, she plans to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en: Ana sells fish.  She is 30 years old, married, with 3 children.  Two of her children go to school.  Ana borrowed a loan to stock more fish for sale.  With the extra profits, she hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: Stock more fish for sale.

loans.name: Philomena

texts.en: Philomena is 32 years old, married and a mother of two.  She sells household goods such as carpets, buckets, basins, jugs, water tanks and brooms.  She has been in the business for six years.  She previously operated a general shop.  She has experienced a drastic improvement in her business since she joined Faulu Kenya and she has hope that her business will continue to grow.  She has requested 65, 000 Kes., to buy iron sheets to renovate her business premise.

loans.use: To buy iron sheets to renovate her business premise.

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en: Chantal is 33 years old, she has 3 children between the ages 6-11 years. All her children are in school and her husband works with her. Chantal sells a traditional fabric called Kitenge. She has been selling these traditional fabrics for 5 years. She is requesting a loan to buy more fabric and make more profits. With the profits in addition to her savings, she plans to build her own house.

loans.use: Buy traditional fabric called Kitenge.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase phone accessories preferred by his customers

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine sells fruits and vegetables.  She is 46 years old, married with 4 children.  None of her children go to school.  Christine took a loan to stock more greens for sale.  With the extra profits, she hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: stock more greens for sale

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 20-year-old single man from Lebanon. He is living with his parents and two siblings who are still attending school. He has owned a snack since 2008. He specializes in preparing delicious beef and chicken sandwiches. He has a large number of customers visiting his shop enjoying his tasty sandwiches. He works hard in cooperation with his father to afford the high costs of living. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase additional tools and equipments to improve his business. In the future, he is planning to redecorate his shop in order to attract more customers.

loans.use: to purchase additional tools and equipment for his shop

loans.name: Erick

texts.en: Erick, a 27-year-old married father of a two-and-a-half-year-old child, has been selling men’s clothing for three years, working hard in order to provide for his family.  Through Faulu Kenya, he has been empowered economically, and he hopes to open other outlets for his business.  Erick, who desires to own real estate in the future, is requesting a loan of 50,000 Kes to buy more clothes.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for his business.

loans.name: Niza Esther

texts.es: Niza desde hace más de 20 años aprendió a ser comerciante porque acompañaba a su madre a que desempeñara esta actividad y aunque nunca pensó vivir de ella, decidió acudir a esta experiencia cuando su cónyuge quedó sin empleo y necesitaban generar ingresos para los gastos del hogar, en el cual existen 3 hijos en las edades de 9, 20 y 15 años. Así que ahora Niza trabaja en su propio negocio de vender ropa, cosméticos, colonias y  toda mercancía que encarguen sus clientes. Ella vende a crédito  a amas de casa, trabajadores independientes, empleados que permanentemente le refieren nuevos y buenos clientes; su mayor desafío es hacer que le alcance su capital de trabajo para poder responder oportunamente a sus clientes y esta es la razón por la cual  se acercó a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para solicitar un crédito; el credikiva es el primer financiamiento y lo aprovechará para responderle a sus clientes, que han solicitado ropa, calzado, colonias ye general mercancía masculina, pues se acerca el día del padre y cada familia quiere halagar a su progenitor haciéndole un regalo. En la actualidad sus hijos estudian y su hijo mayor está en la Universidad y sueña con que él, logre alcanzar su objetivo de ser un comunicador social prestigioso y que sus otros dos hijos también, puedan acceder a una educación de calidad. Mientras Niza construye su sueño, continua trabajando persistentemente para aumentar su capital, generando una rentabilidad no menor del 25 % la que planea incrementar, dirigiendo todos sus esfuerzos hacia ello, porque está entusiasmada y dispuesta a alcanzar sus metas personales y familiares con tal de sentirse feliz con su esposo y sus hijos.
texts.en:
Niza learned how to be a merchant over 20 years ago when she would accompany her mother who was also in this kind of business even though she never thought she’d support herself by it.  She decided to call on it when her spouse lost his job and they needed to generate income to cover household expenses where there were three children whose ages were 9, 20 and 15.  

So now, Niza works in her own business selling clothes, cosmetics, colognes and all sorts of merchandise that her customers order from her.  She sells on credit to housewives, independent workers and employees who permanently refer new and good clients to her.  Her greatest challenge is stretching her capital  to be able to respond in an opportune way to her customers.  This is why she approached Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to request a loan.

The Kiva loan will be her first loan and she’ll use it to respond to her customers that have requested clothes, shoes, colognes and general merchandise for men because Father’s Day is approaching and every family wants to flatter their father by giving him a gift.

Currently her children are studying.  Her oldest son is in the university and she dreams with him that he’ll reach his objective of becoming a prestigious social communicator and that her other two children also will be able to access a quality education.

While Niza builds her dream she continues to work persistently to increase her capital generating a profit margin of no less than 25% which she means to increase aiming all her efforts toward this end.  She is excited and willing to reach her personal and family goals in order to be happy with her husband and children.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, colognes and general merchandise for men.

loans.name: Diappo Liggey Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Diappo Liggey est créé le 12 mai 2010. Il est composé de treize femmes qui habitent le même quartier et ont comme principales activités l'embouche et le petit commerce.



Madame Aminata la responsable est âgée de 26 ans; elle est mariée mère de trois enfants.Sur la photo elle est debout à droite en boubou mauve couverte d'un châle blanc.



 Elle mène une activité de petit commerce diverse marchandises tissus, chaussures, produits alimentaires etc.....Elle a une bonne expérience de plus de dix ans.Elle fait parallèlement de l'embouche bovine.



Son prêt lui servira à acheter des marchandises et des moutons pour renforcer sa capacité de vente.


Son souhait c'est de beaucoup travailler pour obtenir une autonomie financière. Elle aide son mari dans les charges quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The Diappo Liggey solidarity group was set up on 12th May 2010. It is made up of 13 women who live in the same neighborhood and who are mainly active in animal fattening and small trading businesses.

Aminata, who is in charge of the group, is 26 years old; she is married and mother to three children. She is standing on the right of the photo wearing a mauve "boubou" (a West African flowing dress), covered by a white shawl.

She has a small trading activity selling various goods such as fabric, shoes and food products etc. She has more than ten years' experience. She also has a sheep fattening activity.

Her loan will enable her to buy goods and sheep in order to strengthen her sales capacity.

She wants to work a lot in order to become financially independent. She helps her husband with the daily household expenses.

loans.use: to buy fabric, shoes and sheep

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: La Sra. Carmen  se dedica a la compra de muebles usados y venta de muebles nuevos, la señora se dedica a esta actividad hace 3 años, vende cerca del mercado la pampa donde tiene su puesto de venta, vive en domicilio ajeno con contrato en anticrético, su esposo se encuentra en Brasil donde fue a trabajar en costura, tiene 2 hijos actualmente se hace cargo de los estudios y manutención de sus hijos, su trabajo es muy sacrificado tiene que viajar por 3 días a otras ciudades a comprar los muebles para su negocio, la señora indica que el crédito que se le otorgo es de gran ayuda porque con este dinero incrementara su capital de trabajo adquiriendo muebles para después venderlos, es una persona muy trabajadora agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Carmen buys used furniture and sells new furniture.  She’s been in this business for three years.  She sells near the La Pampa Market where she has her sales stand.  She lives in someone else’s house under an “anticrético” contract (a transaction whereby a property owner requests a "loan" from you in exchange for housing, which must be paid back to you at the end of your contract. If your loan is not repaid, the property owner loses the property to you.)  

Her husband is in Brazil where he went to work sewing.  She has two children in her care; she sees to their education and sustenance.  Her work is very demanding.  She has to travel three days to other cities to buy the furniture for her business.  

She indicates that the loan she was granted is of great help because this money will allow her to increase her working capital buying furniture for subsequent sale.  She is a very hard working person who is grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy furniture.

loans.name: Tamasha

texts.en:
Tamasha is a 51 year-old woman from Bilasuvar, Azerbaijan. She is married and lives with her husband and three children. All her children are adults, aged between 19 and 25, and help their parents. They are very diligent family.  The goal of Tamasha and her husband is to support a better life.  

Tamasha owns and operates a store which sells a variety of different home products. She started her business in 2004. This is the first loan Tamasha’s received from AqroInvest and Kiva. She used this loan of 700 AZN to buy more goods to sell in her store. Tamasha hopes this loan will improve income and her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more goods.

loans.name: Peresi

texts.en: Peresi sells green vegetables.  She is 36 years-old and married with five children and all of them go to school.  Peresi took a loan in order to stock more greens to sell.  She hopes to expand her business in the future with the extra profit generated.

loans.use: to stock more greens to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary sells fish.  She is 40 years-old and married with five children and four of them go to school.  Mary borrowed a loan to stock more fish to sell.  She hopes to expand her business in the future with the extra profit generated.

loans.use: to stock more fish to sell.

loans.name: Yelian 2 Group

texts.fr: YELIAN 2 est un groupement constitué de douze personnes et dont la présidente (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est nommée Marie Odile. Les membres du groupe résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement, ce groupement sollicite pour la première fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Née en 1954 au Bénin, Marie Odile est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. Marie Odile ne vit plus avec son mari. Marie Odile vit seule et assure seule ses besoins. Pour y arriver, Marie Odile vend des vivres (haricot, maïs, etc.) dans un marché du Bénin. Marie Odile achète ses produits au Bénin également. Ce premier prêt permettra certainement à Marie Odile et à son groupe de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu.
texts.en:
YELIAN 2 is a group that comprises a dozen people whose president (the one with her hand raised in the photo) is Marie Odile. The group members reside in the same district in Benin. With the goal of increasing its working capital, this group is requesting a loan from ALIDé for the first time.

Born in 1954 in Benin, Marie Odile is the mother of four children, who have all had schooling. She no longer lives with her husband. She lives alone and supports herself. To do so, she sells staple foods (beans, corn, etc.) at a market in Benin. She purchases her goods in Benin, too. 

This initial loan will certainly enable Marie Odile and her group to boost the level of their businesses and to grow their customer base and their revenues.

loans.use: to buy grains (corn, beans, etc.)

loans.name: Jeanine

texts.en: Jeanine is 28 years old and she has three children who are aged between six and ten years old. They are all in school. Her husband is a farmer. Jeanine sells clothes and she has done this business for five years. She also sells goats. This business has enabled her to build her own house and she also bought a garden. She is requesting a loan to buy clothes in order to make more profits. With the profits she plans to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Patricie

texts.en:
Patricie is 51 years-old.  She has 11 children who are aged between five and 34 years-old.  The eldest is not in school because she finished high school and couldn't afford to continue while the rest are in school. 

Patricie sells green bananas while her husband is a farmer. Patricie has sold bananas for nine years and her business is going well. This business has enabled her to buy a cow which gives her milk and also meets her family needs. She is requesting a loan too buy more green bananas to sell in order to make more profit.

loans.use: to sell green bananas.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is 50 years old, married and has four school-going children.  To earn a living, she sells radios, sockets and shoes.  She has operated the business for two years.  So far, she has employed one person in her business.  Through Faulu Kenya, she has learned how to keep business records and this has helped her to run her business well.  She wants 50,000 KES to buy radios.

loans.use: To buy radios to sell

loans.name: Elnur

texts.ru:
Elnur 24 qoda. On ne jenat i ne imeyet detey. Elnur yavlyayetsya IDP personom on pereselenec iz Fuzuili qoroda, seychas projivayet v Baku regione vmeste so svoimi roditelyami. Roditeli Elnura uje pojeliye i ne trudosposobniye , poeotmu semyu soderjit Elnur.
Uje 3 qoda kak Elnur zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit ovec. Seychas Elnur nujdayetsya v 2300 AZN chtobi kupit ovec dlya uvelicheniya kolichestva skota.
texts.en:
Elnur is 24 years old.  He is single and has no children.  Elnur is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  He is a refugee from Fuzuili city who now lives in the Baku area with his parents. Elnura's parents are elderly and unable to work, so Elnur must support the family.  

For three years, Elnur has been working as a shepherd and breeding sheep.  Now Elnur needs 2300 AZN to buy sheep to increase the size of his flock.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Selaphine

texts.en: Selaphine is 35 years old and has four children who are ages 11-13 years old. She works together with her husband. She has been selling green bananas for 14 years. With this business, she bought two gardens in which she grows different types of food for their home. She is requesting a loan to buy green bananas to sell. With the profits she hopes to make and her savings, she plans build her family house

loans.use: To buy green bananas to sell.

loans.name: Sheilah

texts.en:
Sheila is 33 years old and a single mother of one. To raise her six-year-old child, she runs a salon. She has been in this business for ten years. She has sustained her business because of her good service. 

She is determined to grow her business and open other outlets in the future. She hopes to build her own house in the future. She has requested 50,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy hair blow driers and combs.

loans.use: to buy hair blow driers and combs

loans.name: Angelique

texts.en:
Angelique is 35 years old, she has four children who are 1½ to 11 years old. All her children are in school. Her husband is a driver. 

Angelique has been selling sorghum for the past five years. She is requesting a loan to buy more sorghum, and with the profits from increased sales she plans to buy a cow. In the future she plans to build the family a house.

loans.use: To buy sorghum for resale

loans.name: Santa Catarina Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Santa Catarina y esta conformado por 11 mujeres indígenas D. la población D. Santa Catarina Mechoacan. Denominada Santa Catarina por la Virgen Santa Catarina ya que es la patrona D. la población. Mechoacan: significa “Lugar D. Pescadores”. Este grupo esta conformado por mujeres D. raza indígena muy trabajadoras que se dedican a diferentes actividades económicas para el apoyo económico en su hogar.
Gudelia tiene 33 años D. edad, ella es madre soltera tiene 3 hijos que estudian la primaria.
Gudelia tiene un pequeño negocio en su casa donD. venD.  pollo destazado (cortados en pedazo) y mole. Ella solicito el préstamo para comprar mas pollo para que su negocio crezca un poco más, tiene 5 años con su  negocio inicio con el debido a la necesidad que tenia D. mantener a sus hijos y sacarlos adelante, al principio comenzó con pocos pollos D. 5 a 10 pollos al día y sus ventas los realizaba D. casa D. casa en casa y asi fue creciendo poco a poco actualmente venD. D. 30 a 50 pollos.
Para ella es muy importante este negocio ya que con el pueD. mantener a sus hijos y darles educación, ella se esfuerza día con día para que a sus hijos no les falte nada. Es una mujer que a pesar D. las adversidades D. la vida ah salido adelante. Ella esta contenta con su negocio ya que le deja buenas ganancias, actualmente tiene muchos clientes ya que da a buenos precios cada pedazo D. pollo y es el trato que le da sus clientes es bueno y es por ello que va a adquiriendo nuevos clientes.
Su más granD. meta es que sus hijos estudien una profesión y tener un local propio para su negocio.
Las personas que integran este grupo son las siguientes:
Cecilia(Venta D. antojitos regionales), 
Leticia(Venta D. antojitos regionales), 
Cristina(Venta D. antojitos regionales), 
María(Venta D. antojitos regionales), 
Rosa(Venta D. antojitos regionales), 
Cirina (Venta D. antojitos regionales), 
Tomasa (Venta D. pollos),
Gudelia (Venta D. pollos), 
Raquel (Venta D. ropa), 
Zoila (Elaboración D. servilletas), 
Rogelia (Venta D. artículos D. papelería).
texts.en:
This group is called “Santa Catarina” and is composed of 11 indigenous women from the town of Santa Catarina Mechoacan.  It is called Santa Catarina after the Santa Catarina Virgin since she’s the village’s patron saint.  Mechoacan means “Place of the Fishermen.” This group is composed of indigenous, very hard working women who carry out various economic activities to support their homes economically.

Gudelia, 33, is a single mother of three children who are in elementary school.  She has a small, home-based business selling butchered chicken (cut into pieces) and mole (traditional chili sauce).  She asked for the loan to buy more chicken so that her business can grow a bit more.  She’s been in business for five years.  She started because of the need she had to support her children and move them ahead.  At the beginning, she started with just a few chickens, from 5-10 daily and her sales were door to door.  This is how the business gradually grew and now she sells from 30-50 chickens.

This business is very important to her because she’s able to support her children and proviD. them with an education.  She strives daily so that her children will lack nothing.  She is a woman who, despite life’s adversities, has gotten ahead.  She is happy with her business because it produces good profits.  She currently has many customers since she sells each piece of chicken for a good price and the treatment she gives her customers is good; because of this she continues to acquire new customers.

Her main goal is that her children study a profession and to have a locale of her own for the business.

The other group members are:

Cecilia(Sells regional fast food), 
Leticia(Sells regional fast food), 
Cristina(Sells regional fast food), 
María(Sells regional fast food), 
Rosa(Sells regional fast food), 
Cirina (Sells regional fast food), 
Tomasa (Chicken sales),
Gudelia (Chicken sales), 
Raquel (Clothing sales), 
Zoila (Napkin manufacturing), 
Rogelia (Sales of stationery supplies).

loans.use: to buy chickens to sell.

loans.name: El Naranjal Group

texts.es:
En el estado de Oaxaca existe un municipio llamado Acatlan de Perez Figueroa el cual se caracteriza por encontrarse ubicada en una zona cañera, cerca de esta comunidad se encuentra el ingenio azucarero Don Pablo Machado, en esta comunidad se ha creado un grupo llamado la estacion el cual esta integrado por 13 personas.

La señora Alicia es miembro de este grupo, ellaa tiene 35 años de edad, estudio solo la secundaria y se encuentra casada, y tiene 3 hijos los cuales asisten a la primaria  de la comunidad.

Ella nos platica que hace un poco mas de 7 años inicio a vender zapatos y cosmeticos por catalogo, los cuales vende casa por casa con sus amigos y vecinos. Ella primero lleva a mostrar sus catalogos, levanta un pedido, lo encarga a sus proveedores y cuando su paquete llega lo entrega a sus clientes y recibe el pago por sus productos.

Doña Alicia demas de vender sus zapatos y cosmeticos vende de lunes a viernes antojitos mexicanos (empanadas, tostadas. tacos, gorditas) y dulces en la primaria de su comunidad en la hora en la que los niños salen al recreo.

Ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de catalogos, zapatos, perfumeria, cosmeticos, tomates, chiles, cebollas, carne, aceite, sal, crema, queso y gas para preparar su venta y posteriormente vender su antojitos mexicanos.

Ella espera que con esta inversion su negocio propere ya que desea darle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos y que en un furuto estudien una profesion para que puedan salir adelante.

Los demas integrantes del grupo se llaman: Margarita- venta de antojitos mexicanos, Domingo-dulceria, Isidra-venta de refrescos, Guillermo-venta de refrescos, Juana-venta de refrescos, Alejandro-cria de ganado, Blanca-venta de ropa y cultivo de caña, Edith-venta de antojitos mexicanos, Baltazar-ventas de refrescos, Paula-venta de abarrotes, Juana-venta de refrescos y Luz Adriana-venta de antojitos mexicanos.
texts.en:
In the state of Oaxaca, there exists the town called Acatlan de Perez Figueroa which is known for being located in a sugarcane area. Close to this community, you can find the clever sugar farmer, Pablo Machado. In this community, a group named "La Estacion" has been created which is made up of 13 people.

Alicia is a member of this group. She is 35 years old. She finished high school and is married and has three children who attend the community elementary school.

She tells us that a little more than seven years ago, she began to sell shoes and cosmetics from a catalog, which she sold going house to house with her friends and neighbors. She first shows her catalogs, takes an order, sends it to her suppliers and when the package arrives, she takes it to her customers and receives payment for her products.

Alicia, in addition to selling shoes and cosmetics, sells, from Monday to Friday, Mexican snacks (empanadas, tostadas, tacos, gorditas) and sweets at the elementary school in her community at the time when the children come out to play.

She needs this loan to invest it in the purchase of catalogs, shoes, perfumes, cosmetics, tomatoes, chiles, onions, meat, oil, salt, cream, cheese, and soda so she can prepare her sales and later sell her Mexican snacks.

She hopes that, with this investment, her business prospers since she wishes to give a better quality of life to her children and that, in the future, they study a profession so that they can get ahead.

The rest of the members of the group are called: Margarita - sells Mexican snacks, Domingo - candy shop, Isidra - sells refreshments, Guillermo - sells refreshments, Juana - sells refreshments, Alejandro - raises livestock, Blanca - sells clothing and farms sugarcane, Edith -sells Mexican snacks, Baltazar - sells refreshments, Paula - sells groceries, Juana - sells refreshments and Luz Adriana - sells Mexican snacks.

loans.use: to sell Mexican snacks, refreshments, clothing, groceries, cosmetics, plant cane and raise livestock.

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.en: Alphonsine is 33 years old, she has five children who are ages 4 to 13. They are all in school. Alphonsine sells clothes and some traditional fabrics called kitenge. She and her husband have been in this business since 2004. With the profits she earned she has been able to expand her business. She is requesting a loan to buy more clothes and hence make more profits. With the profits together with her savings she plans to build the family a house.

loans.use: To buy clothes for sale.

loans.name: Paix Du Christ Group

texts.fr: Le groupe PAIX DU CHRIST est formé de sept personnes qui habitent toutes ensemble dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommé Sènami Clémentine, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Sènami Clémentine est mariée et mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à sa charge. Sènami Clémentine n'a pas été à l'école. Il y a plus de vingt ans que Sènami Clémentine exerce comme activité, la vente d'ustensiles de cuisine ; ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille et de subvenir à ses besoins. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Sènami Clémentine désire augmenter le stock de ses produits. Pour ce faire, Sènami Clémentine sollicite ensemble avec son groupe, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The PAIX DU CHRIST (Peace of Christ) group is composed of seven persons, who all live in the same neighborhood. The group's representative, whose name is Sènami Clémentine, is the woman with her hand raised on the picture. This is the second time that this group is requesting financial support from ALIDé in order to raise their level of activity.
Sènami Clémentine is married and a mother of four children, who all depend on her financially and go to school. Sènami Clémentine did not attend school. For over twenty years, Sènami Clémentine has been in the business of selling kitchen utensils; this allows her to relatively easily meet her and her family's needs. With the objective to better satisfy her customers' expectations, Sènami Clémentine would like to increase her stock of products. To this end, Sènami Clémentine and her group are requesting together a second loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Bonifilda

texts.en: Bonifilda, 39, has seven children who are ages 6-22; the eldest is adopted. She works together with her husband selling flowers. She has sold flowers for 11 years, and from that business she built a house and has payed her children’s school fees. She grows flowers and buys them as well. She is requesting a loan to buy and grow more flowers. With the profits she plans to pay her children’s school fees.

loans.use: to buy and grow flowers

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
Doña  María Guadalupe, vive en el Estado de Chiapas México, a su responsabilidad tiene cinco hijos y son: asunción de dieciocho años, Santa Luciana de once años, Luis de once años, Narciso de nueve años y Elizabeth de siete años de edad.
    Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de pollos  de granja par criarlo y luego venderlo en la misma localidad, en donde lleva cinco años y comenta que el va bien ya que con ello está logrando sacar adelante a sus hijos que le quedaron pequeños ya que desafortunadamente su esposo falleció  y sé que sola con sus hijo.
    Su inspiración comenzó por si sola  ya que para tener ingresos en su hogar tenía que tener una actividad que le deje ganancias así lograr sacar adelante a sus hijos que son mayor razón de trabajar.
    Su más grande deseo es con que esta actividad pueda seguir trabajando para que así también logre tener a horror y darles una mejor educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
María Guadalupe lives in the State of Chiapas, Mexico.  She has five children in her care: 18 year-old Asunción, 11 year-old Santa Luciana, 11 year-old Luis, 9 year-old Narciso and 7 year-old Elizabeth.  

María's business is buying chickens which she raises and then sells in her town.  She has been in this business for five years and says that it is doing well as it is enabling her to get her children ahead in life.  She and her children were left alone after her husband died.

María made the decision to start her own business since she needed to make income for her household.  She needed a business which would make her profits and enable her to get her children, who are her biggest reason for working, ahead in life.

María's biggest wish is to continue working in this business so that she can save some money and provide her children with a better education.

loans.use: to buy chickens which she will sell in her town

loans.name: Marie Grace

texts.en:
Marie Grace is a 30-year-old Rwandan entrepreneur who owns a general store that sells rice, sugar, and beans. The store has been running for 2.5 years and with the profits she has been able to buy cattle and a piece of land. 

Marie Grace is married and runs the store with her husband. Together they have two children that are two years and three months old. 

This loan will provide Marie Grace with the capital she needs to continue to buy rice and macrones (pasta) that she sells in the store. 

She will use the profits from her business to buy more animals for rearing and increase the stability and quality of life of her family.

loans.use: To buy rice and macrones to sell in her store.

loans.name: Falemon

texts.es:
El señor Falemon, vive en México, es casado y  en total tuvo siete hijos de los cuales tres  están  su responsabilidad y son: Rigoberto de dieciocho años, Osvaldo de quince, María Virgen de once años de edad.
     El dedica a  la compra y venta de ganado para luego venderlo en la misma localidad, en donde lleva aproximadamente diez años y comenta que le va bien ya que con ello a estado sacando adelante a su pequeña familia y solicito el préstamo para agrandar más  su actividad.
     En ello se inspiro ya que cuando  era joven su padre se dedicaba a lo mismo y cuando se caso  decidido hacer lo mismo pero antes salió a otro lugar a trabajar para tener ahorros y así comenzar su negocio, en donde nos dice que le está yendo bien.
     Su más grande deseo es que con el préstamo y su actividad pueda tener ahorrar así día a día agrandar su negocio y apoyar a sus hijo a que estudien como ellos lo desean.
texts.en:
Falemon lives in Mexico.  He is married and had seven children, three of whom are his responsibility: 18 year-old Rigoberto, 15 year-old Osvaldo and 11 year-old María Virgen.

Falemon buys cattle which he later sells in the same town.  He has been in the business for approximately ten years and he says that it is doing well as it has enabled him to get his small family ahead in life.  He requested this loan to further grow his business.

Falemon started working in this business because his father was in the same business when Falemon was young and when he got married he decided to do the same work as his father.  However, first he went off to work somewhere else so that he could put together some savings with which to start his business.

Falemon's biggest wish is that, with this loan and his business, he will be able to save so that he can grow his business day by day and support his children in their studies.

loans.use: to buy cattle which he will sell in the same town.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy thread.

loans.name: Carmelino

texts.es:
Don Carmelio, vive en el Estado de Chiapas, es casado  y tuvo siete hijos quienes ya todos están casado y son: Evangelina de cincuenta y dos año, María Guadalupe de cuarenta y ocho años, Aurelio de  cuarenta y tres años, María Nicolás de de cuarenta años, flor de  treinta y ocho años, Rosita de treinta y cuatro años, y Anita  de treinta y dos años.

    El  se dedica  a la compra y venta de ganados para luego venderlo en la misma localidad, así también elabora panelas que son elaboradas de caña en estas dos actividades comenzó hace treinta y siete años y dos meses, en la que comenta que le va bien ya que con ello logo sacar adelante a su familia.
   
      En esta actividad se inspiro por su propia creatividad ya que para tener ingresos tenía que tener un trabajo que le deje resultados, a si mejorar día adía  su calidad de vida.

    Su más grande deseo es que con esta actividad pueda seguir adelante, y con el préstamo trabajar para elaborar las panelas que luego saldrá a venderla.
texts.en:
Carmelio lives in the State of Chiapas.  He is married and has seven children who are all married: 52 year-old Evangelina, 48 year-old María Guadalupe, 43 year-old Aurelio, 40 year-old María Nicolás, 38 year-old Flor, 34 year-old Rosita and 32 year-old Anita.

Carmelio buys cattle and then sells them in the his town.  He also makes 'panelas' (brown sugarloaf) which are made from sugarcane.  He started his two business activities 37 years and 2 months ago.  He says that business is doing well since, through it, he managed to get his family ahead in life.

Carmelio was inspired to start his business by his own creativity since in order to make income he had to have a job that would get him results so that he could improve his quality of life day by day.

Carmelio's biggest wish is to be able to continue in his business activity and he would like to use his loan to work making sugarloaf that he will then go out to sell.

loans.use: to buy cattle which he will then sell in his town

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en:
Claudine is a 32-year-old Rwandan entrepreneur who runs a general store. She is married and her husband works as a driver.  They have two children who are 2 and 5 years old. She has been running her business for three years and has used the profits to provide clothing, transport, and education for her children.

Claudine will use this loan to purchase sugar, yogurt, rice, wheat flour, and candles that she will sell in her store. She saves the extra profits made from her business in order to provide opportunities for her children in the future.

loans.use: To purchase products such as wheat flour, rice, yogurt, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction supplies - bricks, cement and iron

loans.name: Clementine

texts.en:
Clementine is a Rwandan entrepreneur who runs a store which sells lotions and Vaseline products, and also provides services such as burning CDs and making invitation cards. She is married and has three children, with the youngest being two and the oldest being six.  They are in school apart from the youngest. Clementine has been successfully running her business for four years now, and the profits generated from it have allowed her to pay for her children’s education.  

Clementine wishes to use this loan from Kiva lenders to buy bigger quantities of lotions and Vaseline products so that she can meet the demand of her growing business. 

Loaning to Clementine will help her reach her goal of becoming a wholesaler and saving enough money to buy a house for her family

loans.use: To buy lotions and Vaseline.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
Claudia está aplicando a su segundo credikiva y está satisfecha porque con el anterior le fue muy bien compró, insumos generó utilidades para pagar obligaciones, compró materiales de construcción para iniciar la construcción de su vivienda y hasta tiene un nuevo televisor. Con su nuevo financiamiento espera comprar hilo fino, porque tiene pedidos de hamacas y mochilas las cuales trabaja en compañía de su madre.
Ella envía el siguiente mensaje a sus financiadores e Kiva: “Se les agradece por sus créditos cómodos y  a un interés bueno, espero seguir prestando y contar con ustedes.” Si usted quiere conocer la historia de Claudia ingrese al siguiente enlace:
http://kiva.org/lend/206865
texts.en:
Claudia is applying for her second Kiva loan.  She is satisfied because she did very well with the previous one.  She bought supplies and generated profits to pay her commitments.  She bought building materials to start building her house and she even got a new television set.

She hopes to use the new loan to buy fine yarn because she has pending orders for hammocks and backpacks that she makes with her mother.

She sends the following message to Kiva lenders:  “I’m grateful for your easy loans with good interest rates.  I hope to continue borrowing and to be able to count on you.” 

If you’d like to know Claudia’s story, please click of this link:

http://kiva.org/lend/206865

loans.use: to buy fine yarn in bulk.

loans.name: Yesica

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE TORRECHAYOC”; La socia vive en el distrito de Huanchac; en la provincia de Cusco,  departamento del Cusco.

La  socia  Yesica, la socia  tiene 39 años de edad y La socia es casada; La socia  tiene 2 hijos, de 19,9 años de edad;  La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la docencia, la socia es docente de profesión y alterna sus labores con el comercio minorista , la hija de la socia compra ropa de las fábricas de Lima y los trae a Urubamba a vender a las amistades de la socia que apoya con este negocio a su hija, La socia desea el crédito para invertir en la compra de ropa, la socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de ropa.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito que le otorgarán y de este modo podrá  mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the "Senor de Torrechayoc" community bank. The member lives in the district of Huanchac, in the province and department of Cusco.

The member, Yesica, is 39 years old and is married. She has two children, who are 19 and 9 year old. The member alternates her household activities with teaching. The member's profession is teaching and she alternates her work with retail work. Her daughter buys clothing from Lima's factories and brings them to Urubamba to sell to her friends who support her daughter with this business. The member wants the loan to invest in the purchase of clothing. The member is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of clothing.

The member values and is infinitely thankful for the loan that will be granted to her and, in this way, will enable her to improve her quality of life. In addition, she promises to make her payments at the stipulated times.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of clothing.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a dairy farmer from Litein town in Rift Valley, Kenya. He has been in the farming business for ten years and employs two farmhands. He sells his milk on the local market. He earns additional income from small-scale farming of tea. He is also employed as a guard in one of the local schools. 

Charles has made his second loan request from Juhudi Kilimo of 80,000Kes. He intends to use this loan to purchase a dairy cow. The extra income from the sale of milk will help improve his family's livelihood. He plans to expand his farming activities in future by acquiring additional dairy cows.

Charles is 31 years old and married with two children aged two and four years.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es: Manuel en la hermosa ciudad de Cartagena,  tiene un negocio de venta de refrescos y bebidas, con el cual logra apoyar el sostenimiento de su familia, conformada por su esposa y 4 hijos en las edades de 11 a 24 años. El inició su negocio vendiendo minutos a celulares y cervezas en su barrio y a este negocio adicionó un billar y vende cervezas no solo al detal sino también por cajas, aprovechando que sus vecinos comerciantes, se quedan sin inventarios en momentos de gran movilización comercial, por el poco capital de trabajo que manejan. Manuel es un buen miembro de familia, cuenta con el apoyo de todos los integrantes de su hogar y en el negocio con uno de sus hijos, que también trabaja con él.  Este es el segundo financiamiento que recibe de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará cajas de cervezas por volumen y gaseosas, pues desde ya se está provisionando para la temporada del día del padre,  que viene con mucho movimiento comercial especialmente de los productos que Manuel vende. Su sueño es mantener activo su negocio y darle un apartamento a cada uno de sus hijos, con su financiamiento anterior logró aumentar su capital de trabajo y agradece la confianza que la Fundación ha depositado en él y en su familia.
texts.en: Manuel, in the beautiful city of Cartagena, owns a business selling refreshments and drinks, with which he manages to support his family, made up of his wife and four children who are between the ages of 11 and 24. He started his business selling cell phone minutes and beers in his neighborhood and, to this business, he added billiards and sells beer not only at retail but also by the case, taking advantage of the fact that his neighbors are traders who are left without inventory during moments of great demand due to the small amount of working capital they have to work with. Manuel is a good member of the family. He can count on the support of all the members of his family and, with the business, on one of his children who also works with him. This is the second loan that he has received from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which he will buy cases of beer and soda so that he is stocked for the father's day season that is accompanied by a lot of commercial movement, especially with the products that Manuel sells. His dream is to keep his business active and give an apartment to each one of his children. With his previous loan, he was able to expand his working capital and he is thankful for the trust the Foundation has given him and his family.

loans.use: to buy cases of beers and sodas.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is a 34-year-old Rwandan entrepreneur who sells new children’s and adult clothing.  He has been running his business for 12 years and uses a car for his business which he has used part of his profit to pay for. His successful business has also allowed him to afford to build a house for his family. Jean is married with five children, two of whom he is supporting from another wife. The youngest is nine and the oldest is 13 years old.

Jean will combine the loan with his savings in order to buy another car for his business. He hopes to continue to grow his business so as to be able to pay the school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy a car for his business.

loans.name: Carmen Maria

texts.es: Carmen Tiene un negocio donde vende artículos de la canasta familiar llamado “Mercaditos”,  ella vive en el barrio Daniel Lemetre con su esposo y tiene tres hijos en las edades de 31 a 38 años. Carmen inició este negocio hace 6 años, después que su esposo quedó desempleado y se le ocurrió la idea de venderle, arroz, aceite, leche en polvo enlatados y víveres en general a los empleados de dos empresas cercanas del sector, a quienes empezó distribuyendo sus pedidos a crédito, mientras ella compraba de contado y en volumen ganándose los descuentos y una utilidad aprovechada para el sostenimiento de su hogar. Así en tiempo de crisis su negocio apoyó los gastos de su familia y ha logrado sostenerlo hasta el dio de hoy  vendiendo los famosos mercaditos que incluyen compras para el consumo de las familias cartageneras durante un periodo de tiempo. El Credikiva  es el primer financiamiento que hace Carmen a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y con el comprará azúcar, aceite, arroz, elementos de aseo personal, para responder a nuevos clientes que cada día engrosan la lista de pedidos de mercaditos.  Su sueño más adelante es tener un depósito formalizado para responder más oportunamente a sus clientes y generar a otras familias fuentes de ingreso a través de su negocio.
texts.en:
Carmen has a business where she sells family use baskets called "Mercaditos".  She lives in the Danniel Lemetre neighborhood with her husband and has three children, ages 31 to 38.  She began her business six years ago after her husband lost his job and she came up with the idea of selling rice, oil, canned milk powder and general foods to employees of local companies.  She began distributing her orders on a credit basis although she bought her products with cash and obtained volume discounts.  She took advantage of the situation to support her family.

So in times of crisis her business covered household expenses and she has been able to keep it going until today selling the famous family baskets for long-term consumption.  The Credikiva loan is Carmen's first through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation.  She will use it to buy sugar, oil, rice and personal hygiene products to respond to the new clients added to the "mercaditos" order list.  Her dream is to have a larger inventory so she can serve her customers in a timely fashion and help generate income for other families through her business.

loans.use: To buy sugar, oil, rice and personal hygiene products.

loans.name: Aleyda

texts.es: Aleyda tiene 33 años, es una mujer muy amable y sincera, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Mario de 34 años y sus 4 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo de Aleyda consiste en la compra y venta de pescado, y lo hace de manera ambulatorio, en donde distribuye sus productos a sus clientes, quienes le compran a precios muy cómodos. Ella procura que el pescado que vende sea el más fresco, por ello siempre va desde muy temprano al terminal pescadero para conseguir este alimento fresco. Se considera una vendedora muy alegre, y muy servicial con sus clientes y eso le ha dado ventaja en el comercio, ya tiene 14 años realizando esta actividad, sin embargo le molesta aún el olor se le impregne, pero sabes que es parte de este trabajo. Mas adelante desea tener un frigorífico donde pueda almacenar y  vender pescado sin temor a que se malogren con el calor del sol. Este será el décimo segundo crédito con MFP, y espera pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy querida, por la alegría que pone en el grupo. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más pescado, ya que últimamente esta teniendo más demanda.
texts.en:
Aleyda is 33 years old.  She is a very kind and sincere woman who lives in her own home together with her husband, 34 year-old Mario, and her four beloved children who she would like to provide with a better quality of life.

Aleyda's work is buying and selling fish.  She does not sell from a fixed sales location but rather delivers her products to her customers who buy from her at very reasonable prices.  Aleyda works hard to ensure the fish she sells is as fresh as possible.  She goes to the fish market very early to buy her fresh fish.  She considers herself to be a very cheerful saleswoman who is very helpful to her customers.  This has given her an advantage in her sales business.  She has been in this business for 14 years but the smell still bothers her as it pervades everything.  However, she knows that it is part of this work.  In the future, Aleyda would like to own a refrigerator where she can store and sell fish without having to worry about it going off in the heat of the sun.

This will be Aleyda's twelfth loan from MFP and she hopes to make all her repayments on time.  She is a very well-liked member of her community bank because of the cheerfulness that she brings to the group.  She will use the 1,500 Peruvian soles she has requested to buy more fish since she has experienced more demand recently.

loans.use: to buy more fish wholesale

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to boost her son’s business of selling clothes. His shop is located in the market and he sells different varieties of clothing to his customers. He purchases the clothes from Multan and Faisalabad which are known for their textiles. 

Razia is the mother of two sons and both of them have the same business. Her husband is elderly and can’t work due to his older age; that’s why he spends time at home. 

Razia is confident about the positive growth of her son’s business and about the better financial future of her family as a result of a loan investment. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Razia.

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Anathalia

texts.en:
Anathalia is a 47-year-old Rwandan entrepreneur who runs a hardware store with her husband.  The store sells many goods such as hoes, construction materials, paint, and tents and has been operating successfully since 2004. Anathalia and her husband have five children ranging in age from 9 to 22 years old.

With the loan, she plans to buy more tents and paint so that she can continue to meet the demands of her customers. With the extra money generated thus far from this business, Anathalia has been able to buy a house and car and support her children through school. This loan will help her continue to be able to support the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy tents and paint for sale.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita, de 26 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en casa de sus padres junto a su esposo Ricardo de 40 años y su querido hijo Jairo de 2 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Los ahorros que había guardado Margarita durante mucho tiempo, por fin tiene sus frutos, puesto que con ellos pudo comprar el carro que tanto ansiaba, y ahora lo a puesto a trabajar como vehículo colectivo en la ciudad de Pucallpa. Gracias a esto sus ingresos han mejorado, ya que anteriormente percibía muy poco dinero de los trabajos eventuales que realizaba. Lleva 3 años en esta actividad y lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es que le permite viajar constantemente y disfrutar de los paisajes que recorre, sin embargo tiene que madrugar para cumplir y llevar a sus pasajeros quienes la esperan a esa hora. Sabe que es muy duro este trabajo pero a la larga le dará muy buenos resultados económicos. En el futuro desea comprar otro carro, por ello pide de su colaboración para salir adelante. Este será el sexto crédito con MFP, por lo que tiene que cumplir con todas sus cuotas a tiempo, si no quiere causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, en el cual es muy querida por la alegría que demuestra. Con los tres mil doscientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará repuestos para su carro, ya que con el paso del tiempo se ha ido deteriorando.
texts.en:
Margarita is 26 years old.  She is a very kind and hard-working woman who lives in her parents' home together with her husband, 40 year-old Ricardo, and her beloved son, 2 year-old Jairo, who she would like to provide with a better quality of life.

The savings that Margarita had built up over a long period of time finally provided their return as she was able to use them to buy the car that she had so longed for.  She has now put the vehicle to work as a 'collective vehicle' (a taxi with a fixed route and fare), in the city of Pucallpa.  Thanks to this, her income has improved since she previously made very little money from the temporary jobs that she did.  She has been in this business for three years and what she most enjoys about her work is that it allows her to travel all the time and enjoy the countryside that she passes through.  However, she has to get up very early in the morning to do her work and transport her passengers who are waiting for her at that hour.  She knows that this work is very hard but, in the long run, it will provide her with very good financial results.  In the future, she would like to buy another car and so she is asking for your cooperation in helping her to get ahead.

This will be Margarita's sixth loan from MFP and she must make her repayments on time if she doesn't want to cause problems for the members of her community bank.  Margarita is a very well-liked member of her community bank because of her cheerfulness.  She will use the 3,200 Peruvian soles she has requested to buy spare parts for her car since, over time, it has become worn.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her vehicle

loans.name: Zulma Leonor

texts.es: Zulma  vive en Costa hermosa y tiene una microempresa donde ofrece servicios odontológicos , negocio que resultó después de haber trabajado en una Institución prestadora de servicios que  se terminó y quedó sin este empleo que era fijo; así que  Zulma decidida buscó un local, lo adecuó y hoy no se cambia por nadie y tiene muchos sueños de hacer  crecer  su microempresa; ella está entusiasmada porque le ha ido bien,  apoya la gestión de su hogar, conformado por su cónyuge y sus tres hijos en las edades de 2 a 15 años de edad, con los que sueña ver exitosos y son su motivación para lograr una educación de calidad. Todos estos sueños llevan a Zulma a que trabaje persistentemente, ella además de tener un consultorio independiente, también presta este servicio en Instituciones prestadoras de servicio en las tardes y hasta de noche y hay mucha gente que  reconoce su trabajo de calidad y le refiere a otros clientes; en su consultorio Zulma presta los servicios de limpiezas odontológicas, extracciones, prótesis, tratamientos de conducto, y también hace resinas. Este es su primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con la cual realizará mejoras al local donde funciona, pues quiere adecuarlo y darle una imagen moderna que impacte desde la visión física el servicio ofrecido.
texts.en:
Zulma lives in Costa Hermosa and has a small dental practice.  Previously, she worked in a private institution but when her employment ended she decided to look for a location to set up her own business.  Now she would not change her situation for anything in the world and dreams of growing her business because she has been successful to date and able to help cover household expenses.  She lives with her husband and three children, ages 2 through 15.  She wants to see them all get ahead and receive a quality education.

Because of her dreams Zulma works persistently.  In addition to her private practice she also lends services in institutions in the afternoons and evenings.  Many people know she offers quality work and they recommend her to other customers.  Zulma provides cleaning, extractions, dental prostheses, root canals and crown work.  This is her first loan through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation.  She plans to use it to make improvements at her office in order to give it a more modern image in line with the services offered.

loans.use: To renovate her dental practice.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a 29-year-old Rwandan entrepreneur who sells fruit in the market. She has been running this business for almost two years and has used the profits to build a house. She is married to a construction worker and has five children ranging in age from 8 to 12.  All of the children are in school.
Beatrice will use this loan to buy produce such as bananas, passion fruits, tree tomatoes, and other fruits to sell in the market so she can continue to run a sustainable business. As Beatrice has a large family, she wishes to use the profits from her business to renovate her house and pay for her children’s education in order to improve the overall quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy fruit such as bananas, passion fruits and tree tomatoes.

loans.name: Khalida's Group

texts.en:
Khalida is a housewife who stays at home and does her household responsibilities. Her husband runs an auto workshop in the community. He is an expert in his work and can repair any vehicle. Khalida’s only son also works with his father. He is learning the techniques from him. 

Khalida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the betterment of her husband’s auto workshop business. With the loan, he will purchase the latest repair tools and spare parts to provide better repair facilities to his customers. Khalida is hopeful that the loan will bring more profits to her husband and make a positive impact on his business.

loans.use: To buy repair tools and spare parts

loans.name: Zoila

texts.es: Zoila, de 49 años, es una mujer muy amable y sencilla, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Jorge de 52 años y sus 2 queridas hijas menores Geraldine de 16 y Sharon de 9 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. En su propia casa Zoila tiene un puesto de comida donde vende sus deliciosos platillos, el aroma que sale de sus ricos potajes es suficiente para atraer a los clientes, su puesto es muy concurrido y por lo general vende mucho durante toda la noche. Tiene 32 años en este negocio, el cual le ha dado el dinero necesario para alimentar a sus hijas y pagar sus estudios, pero siente que más adelante va a tener más gastos y el dinero le va a faltar, por eso desea poner un restaurante, donde pueda vender con más comodidad sus sabrosos platos y así mejorar su ingresos económicos. A ella le gusta conversar con sus clientes, disfruta mucho haciéndolo, pero le es muy difícil atender a todas las personas que concurren a su puesto, pero igual no decae en su afán de salir adelante y esta dispuesta a trabajar mucho para lograrlo. Este será el séptimo crédito con MFP y espera poder pagar a tiempo y no traerle problemas a su banco comunal, en donde es muy respetuosa con las demás socias. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más ingredientes para preparar más comida.
texts.en:
Zoila is 49 years old.  She is a very kind and simple woman who lives in her own home together with her husband, 52 year-old Jorge, and her two beloved daughters, 16 year-old Geraldine and 9 year-old Sharon, who she would like to provide with a better quality of life.

In her own home, Zoila has a sales location where she sells her delicious dishes.  The wonderful smell that comes from her delicious stews is enough to attract her customers.  Her business is very busy and, in general, she sells a lot of meals all evening long.  Zoila has been in this business for 32 years and it has made her the money she needs to feed her daughters and pay for their education.  However, she feels that, in the future, she will have more expenses and she will not have enough money to cover them.  For this reason, she would like to set up a restaurant where she can sell her tasty meals more comfortably and thereby improve her income.  Zoila enjoys chatting to her customers and has fun doing so but it is very difficult serving all the people who come to her business.  However, she does not falter in her desire to get ahead in life and she is prepared to work hard in order to achieve this.

This will be Zoila's seventh loan from MFP and she hopes to be able to make her repayments on time so as not to cause problems for her community bank where she is very respectful towards the other members.  Zoila will use the 3,000 Peruvian soles she has requested to buy more ingredients so that she can prepare more meals.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for making meals

loans.name: Adelphine

texts.fr:
Maman de 55ans ,  mariée , mère de 6 enfants dont l'âge varie entre 23ans et 39ans. Avec son  niveau d'étude  primaire, elle se lance dans la restauration depuis 5ans.
Son restaurant est en plein marché ou elle commence à vendre   dès 7heures pour finir à 16heures.
Sa clientèle est composée des vendeurs du marché et des passants.
Ses recettes journalière sont comprises entre 18000F et 25000f.
Avec le prêt, elle va augmenter son stock de marchandise en réserve, pour cela , elle va acheter:
1 carton de poisson salé, 1 carton de viande de bœuf, 1 filets d'oignon, 10 boîtes de tomate, 1 sac de riz, 2 sachets de sel fin, 5 fagots de bois de chauffe, 1 sac de charbon.
Compte tenu des exigences de ses clients , son ambition est de vendre beaucoup, faire plus de bénéfices et économiser afin d'ouvrir un restaurant plus moderne.
Aider ses petits financièrement en soutenant leurs études.
texts.en:
Maman is 55 years old, married and the mother of six children between the ages of 23 and 39. With only a primary education, she started her restaurant business five years ago.
Her restaurant is in the middle of the market where she starts to sell at seven in the morning until four in the afternoon.

Her clients are sellers at the market and other passersby.

Her daily earnings are between 18,000 and 25,000 cfa francs.

With the loan, she would like to increase her inventory by purchasing:
1 case of salted fish, 1 case of beef, 1 sack of rice, 1 can of oil, 1 bag of onions, 10 boxes of tomatoes, 2 bags of salt, 5 bundles of wood, 1 bag of charcoal.
With her clients in mind, her goal is to increase sales, make larger profits and save money in order to open a more modern restaurant and to help her children financially with their studies.

loans.use: to purchase: 1 case of salted fish, 1 case of beef, 1 sack of rice, 1 can of oil, 1 bag of onions, 10 boxes of tomatoes, 2 bags of salt, 5 bundles of wood, 1 bag of charcoal.

loans.name: Geovan

texts.en:
Geovan is a Rwandan businesswoman who runs a shop that sells new children’s clothes. Her business has proven to be incredibly successful, and it has expanded 6-fold during the five years she has been running it.  She is married and her husband is a soldier.  They have four children ranging in age from 5 to 13, and all of them are enrolled in school.

With this loan Geovan plans to buy more children’s clothes for ages 0 to 12, which will allow her to meet the demand of her growing clientele.

Geovan will use the profits from her business to reinvest and grow her capital so that she can continue to expand her business and provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy children's clothing for resale.

loans.name: Sauda

texts.en:
Sauda lives in Uganda. She is married and has 6 children, all of whom are in school. Sauda has operated a business selling charcoal for 3 years, and she works 6 days out of every week. Sauda sells her products at the market. She has requested a loan of 1,600,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal.

Sauda also generates additional income through rental rooms. Her main business challenges include seasonality and thieves. Sauda's goals and hopes for her business are to own a wholesale shop and to build her own rental house. Sauda lives in a home that she owns; she has no access to electricity nor piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food for the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Tesalia

texts.es: Tesalia, de 47 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo José de 56 años y su querida hija menor Cristel de 18 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. La actividad a la que se dedica Tesalia es el alquiler de motocarros, es así que todos los días desde muy temprano por la mañana, llegan jóvenes conductores quienes desean alquilar uno de sus motocarros para ganar un poco de dinero durante el día. Paralelamente a esta actividad también se dedica al transporte por lancha de productos de la región, negocio que le está generando muy bueno ingresos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que ayuda a las personas a generarse un ingreso manejando los motocarros que posee. Lleva 8 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que supervisar que los motocarros sean regresados en buen estado. Este será el vigésimo primer crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas puntualmente y esta dispuesta a hacerlo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, donde es muy respetada. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará repuestos para  los motocarros, ya que por el uso algunas piezas se han deteriorado.
texts.en:
Tesalia is 47 years old.  She is a very kind and hard-working woman who lives in her own home together with her husband, 56 year-old José, and her beloved daughter, 18 year-old Cristel, who she would like to provide with a better quality of life.

Tesalia's business activity is hiring out motorcycle taxis.  Every day, from very early in the morning, young drivers who would like to earn a little money during the day turn up to hire one of her motorcycle taxis.  In addition to this business, Tesalia also transports regional products by motorboat.  That business is making her very good income.  What Tesalia most enjoys about her work is helping people to make an income by managing the motorcycles that she owns.  She has been in this business for eight years and she considers the most difficult part of her work to be having to check that the motorcycles are returned in good condition.

This will be Tesalia's twenty-first loan from  MFP.  She knows that she must make her repayments on time and she is prepared to do so since she does not want to cause problems for the other members of her community bank where she herself is a very well-respected member.  Tesalia will use the 3,000 Peruvian soles she has requested to buy spare parts for her motorcyle taxis since some parts have become worn through use.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her motorcycle taxis

loans.name: Kishwer's Group

texts.en:
Kishwer is 50 years old, married and has three sons. Her two elder sons sell vegetables while the youngest one reads in class 2. Her husband also operates a vegetable selling business. His shop is located in the market and he sells good quality fresh vegetables to his clients at reasonable prices. Kishwer herself is a housewife, staying at home and doing her household work. She is a very good administrator and manages her household expenses very well. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who wants to improve his business by purchasing fresh seasonal vegetables. He has been operating this business for the past 12 years and is a very hard-working person. Kishwer is very hopeful that an investment will bring more profits to him and improve the financial condition of his business.

loans.use: To buy fresh seasonal vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Nohemi Julia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE TORRECHAYOC”; La socia vive en el distrito de Huanchac; en la provincia de Cusco,  departamento del Cusco.

La  socia Nohemi, la socia  tiene 45 años de edad y La socia es soltera; La socia  tiene 2 hijos, de 16,14 años de edad;  La socia 
alterna sus actividades del hogar con comercio, la socia compra al por mayor golosinas, helados, la socia desea implementar su negocio y para ello comprara, golosinas, al por mayor, y los insumos para la elaboración de helados. La socia solicita el préstamo para  invertir en la compra de golosinas e insumos.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito que le otorgarán y de este modo podrá  mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "SEÑOR DE TORRECHAYOC".  She lives in the district of Huancha, in the province and department of Cusco.

Nohemi, 45, is single and has two children, ages 16 and 14.  She alternates her daily activities with her retail business selling sweets and ice cream.  She plans to use the loan to buy wholesale sweets and ingredients to make ice cream.

She is very grateful for the loan, which will help her improve her lifestyle, and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy sweets and supplies.

loans.name: Pedro José

texts.es:
El señor Pedro  es padre de familia, tiene tres hijos adolescentes que actualmente estudian.
Esta solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar el material que es el cemento, varilla y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de realizar la mejora. Ya que a su casa le esta haciendo falta el techo porque actualmente lo tiene de madera y lamina.  Tiene el proyecto de construir una losa de concreto para que la casa sea más segura y duradera.
 Solicita el préstamo para esa construcción y planea pagar con sus ingresos que obtiene de su trabajo.
Su deseo es que sus hijos tengan su propio cuarto y vivan mejor.
texts.en:
Pedro is a father with three adolescent children who are currently in school. 

He is requesting a loan so that he can buy materials such as cement and reinforcing bars and pay the person who will carry out the work. This is because his house needs a roof; it is currently covered with wood and metal sheeting. He plans to construct a concrete slab roof so that his house will be more secure and durable. 

He is requesting the loan for this construction, and he plans to pay for it with the income he obtains from his work. 

His desire is that his children can have their own room and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to build a concrete slab roof for his house.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.
