Anass is requesting a loan from A. Majmoua in order to buy new chairs and tables to accommodate the additionA. customers coming to his shop. He hopes to expand his business in the future by opening a larger coffee shop in a new area.

loans.use: To buy more chairs and tables for his coffee shop.

loans.name: Enrique

texts.es: Enrique, tiene la edad 29 de  años, está en unión libre y vive con  su esposa que es su mayor prioridad. El  lo que pretende es realizar la compra de los insumos necesarios para la asistencia de los cultivos. El alquila el terreno a un vecino y lo tiene ya sembrado lo que quiere es generar las ganancias necesarias para seguir adelante con el proyecto der los granos básicos y ser un gran agricultor de la zona. También pretende generar las ganancias para tener una mejor calidad de vida con su esposa y seguir adelante con sus proyectos personales. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Enrique, 29, lives with his wife who is his main priority.  He intends to use the loan to buy farming supplies to enhance his crops.  He leases the land from a neighbor and has already planted it and what he wants is to generate the necessary profits to continue with his basic grains project and become a great farmer in the area providing his wife with better wellbeing and to continue with his personal projects.


This is the first loan he’s gotten from FUDECOSUR.  He has had no previous loans from state banks but FUDECOSUR has offered him the best loan terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Reinaldo

texts.es:
Reinaldo  vive la comunidad de Mollejones en Perez Zeledon.
El es uno de los miembros de la junta Directiva de de la empresa de Crédito Comunal de Bancruce S.A, una de las 110 empresas socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
El solicita un préstamo de ₡358 000 (trescientos cincuenta y ocho  mil colones) para la compra de una computadora portátil  que es para el manejo de Empresa de Crédito Bancruce S.A
 En este momento es de mucha importancia ya que necesitan mejorar  el servicio al cliente, y así aumentar sus ingresos, esto impulsara  el crecimiento de la Empresa.
texts.en:
Reinaldo lives in the community of Mollejones in Pérez Zeledón.  He is one of the members of the board of directors of Bancruce S.A Communal Bank, one of EDESA’s 110 social enterprises in Costa Rica.

He is asking for a ₡358 000 (three-hundred and fifty-eight thousand colones) loan to buy a portable computer which will be used in the management of the Bancruce S.A. communal bank.

At this moment, this is very important because they need to improve customer service in order to increase income.  This will propel the enterprise’s growth.

loans.use: to buy a laptop computer.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.es:
Leonardo tiene 27 años de edad, vive en casa propia, es casado. Su domicilio está ubicado en la zona rural de un  Caserío  del distrito de Morrope. 

Leonardo se se ha dedicado gran parte de su vida a comprar y criar animales  como ovejas, cabras, ganado vacuno, y  aves como por ejemplo pavos, pollos y patos para que posteriormente los venda.  De esta manera Leonardo ha encontrado en esta actividad un negocio en la que se vuelto una experta en la crianza y así solventa sus gastos obtiene ganancias.

Leonardo el desea adquirir más animales y alimento balanceado para ampliar su negocio y percibir mayores ingresos, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Leonardo es una persona bastante empeñosa y trabajadora, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Leonardo tiene 27 años de edad, vive en casa propia, es casado. Su domicilio está ubicado en la zona rural de un  Caserío  del distrito de Morrope. 

Leonardo se se ha dedicado gran parte de su vida a comprar y criar animales  como ovejas, cabras, ganado vacuno, y  aves como por ejemplo pavos, pollos y patos para que posteriormente los venda.  De esta manera Leonardo ha encontrado en esta actividad un negocio en la que se vuelto una experta en la crianza y así solventa sus gastos obtiene ganancias.

Leonardo el desea adquirir más animales y alimento balanceado para ampliar su negocio y percibir mayores ingresos, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Leonardo es una persona bastante empeñosa y trabajadora, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

loans.use: Adquirir más animales y alimento balanceado.

loans.name: Gerardo Ernesto

texts.es:
Gerardo, tiene treinta años de edad, vive con sus padres y una hermana, tiene un negocio de venta de productos comestibles como galletas, jugos, sodas, dulces y más.
El actualmente solicita un préstamo para aumentar su mercadería, comprando más de la antes mencionada, ya que son los productos que vende desde hace 6 años, con esta compra espera fortalecer y crecer en el negocio.
Su aspiración es crecer, mejorar las condiciones y calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Gerardo is 30 years old and lives with his parents and his sister.  He has a business selling food products such as biscuits, juice, soda, candy and more.
He is currently requesting a loan to increase his merchandise, buying more of the aforementioned, since they are the products he has been selling for 6 years. With this acquisition he hopes to strengthen and grow the business.  His aspiration is to grow, improve conditions and quality of life.

loans.use: To buy biscuits, juice, soda, candy, and more.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: Julio Cesar es soltero, tiene 27 años de edad, es maestro de educación física, se dedica a impartir enseñanza sobre curso de deportes y tambien es arbitro en las diferentes ramas deportivas, tiene 2 años de experiencia en esta profesion. Decide solicitar un préstamo que le servirá para la compra de una computadora para uso personal, ya que debido a la necesidad de tener su informacion a tiempo y ordenada, va a comprar este activo que le beneficiará mucho en su desepeño laboral, con el fin de mejorar su condición de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Julio Cesar is 27 years old and single.  He is a physical education teacher who teaches all types of sports and is also a referee for a variety of sporting events.  He has two years of experience in this profession.  He decided to request a loan to buy a computer for personal use, since he needs to have information in a timely and orderly fashion.  This purchase will benefit him a lot in carrying out his work, and will help him toward his goal of improving the living conditions for himself and for his family.

loans.use: to buy a computer

loans.name: Olimpio

texts.es: Olimpio tiene 68 años, vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Hace más de 31 años decidió incursionar en el comercio, es así que tiene una tienda, en donde vende productos de primera necesidad. Desde entonces le va muy bien en las ventas, aunado a que su negocio se ubica en una zona donde hay mucha afluencia de gente, garantizando así más ventas. Procura siempre de abastecerse de productos, de ello depende de que sus clientes vayan seguidos a su establecimiento. Él siempre esta pendiente de las necesidades de sus consumidores y ver que productos son de su preferencia y eso le favorece en el negocio. El tiempo donde hay más ventas son en fiestas patrias y navideñas, por ello espera ahorrar dinero para abastecerse de mercadería para las próximas fiestas patrias que se acercan, por tal motivo espera de su apoyo para concretar sus planes. Este será su crédito número 18 con MFP,  es uno de los socios más antiguos de su banco comunal que siempre motiva a los demás integrantes a ser unidos, responsables y colaboradores de las diversas actividades que se proponen. En esta ocasión el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería, para tener mayor variedad de productos en su tienda.
texts.en:
Olimpio, 68, lives with his wife and two children in his own home.  Over 31 years ago he decided to go into commerce.  He has a store where he sells basic need items.  He has done very well with his sales thanks to the fact that his store is located in a spot where there is much foot traffic thereby insuring sales.  He always strives to be well stocked with merchandise because this is what brings his customers back to his store repeatedly.  He is always conscious of his customers’ needs to see which products are their preferred ones and this benefits his business.  The time when sales are highest is during national holidays and during the Christmas season.  Because of this, he hopes to save money to stock up on merchandise for the approaching national holidays.  He hopes to have your support to meet this goal.

This will be loan #18 with MFP.  He is one of the longest standing members of his communal bank who always motivates the others to be united, responsible and collaborative in the various activities they propose for themselves.  On this occasion, he will use the requested loan to buy merchandise in order to have wider variety of products available in his store.

loans.use: to buy stock items for his store.

loans.name: Nicasio

texts.es:
Nicasio, es un agricultor de 55 años de edad, vive con su esposa y tres hijos de las edades de 12, 14 y 17 años de edad, él lleva más de 20 años de dedicarse al cultivo de maíz y frijol, lo cual lo realiza en un terreno alquilado, cultivando una manzana de maíz y media de frijol, de esta siembra, la mitad de la producción es la venderla y la otra parte es para el consumo familiar.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas, como lo es abono y tratamiento para plagas, pues iniciara la siembra de maíz y frijol, espera que con la compra de estos insumos pueda obtener una buena cosecha.
Sus sueños es ver crecer a sus hijos y convertidos en profesionales, para que puedan optar por un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Nicasio is a 55-year old farmer who lives with his wife and three children aged 12, 14, and 17. For more than 20 years, he's grown a manzana (1 acre = .57 manzana)of corn and half a manzana of beans on rented land. Half of the produce is sold and the other half is for the family to eat.

Nicasio is seeking a loan to buy agricultural supplies such as fertilizer and insecticide. Then he will begin sowing corn and beans. He is hopeful that the purchase of these supplies will enable him to get a good harvest.

His dream is to see his children grow up and get good jobs so they can choose  a better future.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies such as fertilizer and insecticide

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela  es socia del Banco Comunal “3 de Mayo” ubicado en el distrito Ilave, provincia El Collao y departamento de Puno, tiene 53 años de edad, esl madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos.  La señora no cuenta con estudios.
Graciela siempre se ha dedicado a la venta de artículos artesanales como: chalinas, chullos, chales, guantes, bordados en bayeta (tela de la región) y tejido en miniaturas.  Su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio.  Trabaja hace siete años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos.
Ahora solicitará un nuevo préstamo por la suma de S/. 1300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá en la compra de bayetas, kiler para pantalón negro y camisa, seis conos de lana de diferentes colores y alphantina de todo color, todo esto para la confección de sus prendas de artesanía, la señora dice que lo vende en Uros Chulluni.  En el negocio la ayuda su hija.
Su sueño es poder exportar los productos ella misma porque dice que prácticamente “los regala a los  vendedores”... “no pagan como debe  de ser, no pagan a su precio”.
Lo que le  gusta del Banco Comunal es la puntualidad y lo que gana el ahorro.
texts.en: Graciela is a member of the community bank "3 de Mayo," located in Ilave, El Collao, Puno, Peru. She is a 53-year-old single mother of two children, and has never had any formal education. Graciela has always worked at selling handmade items: scarves, hats, shawls, gloves, embroidered cloths (made with local fabric), small handkerchiefs, etc. She put her first loan of 300 Soles into her business. Graciela has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for seven years. Now she has requested a new loan of 1300 Soles, which she will use to buy cloth for making shirts and black slacks. She will also buy six skeins of yarn, each in a different colour, an every colour of embroidery thread. She will use all these materials to make handcrafted merchandise, which she will sell in Uros Chulluni. The money she makes through her business also helps her daughter. Graciela's dream is to export her goods on her own terms. At this point, she's practically giving them away to other dealers, who never pay her what things are worth. Graciela's favourite features of her community bank are how quickly things get done, and how much she's able to save.

loans.use: buy cloth, fabric for shirts and slacks, six skeins of coloured wool and embroidery thread of every colour.

loans.name: Jose Tomas

texts.es:
José, vive con su madre, está soltero y se dedica a la venta de cubrecamas, con este negocio ayuda a su madre a cubrir gastos del hogar, él vende en las colonias todos los días de la semana.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de cubrecamas de diferentes colores, ya que la demanda es mucha y quiere diversificar los estilos para ofrecer a los clientes y generar ventas.
Su aspiración es comprarse un vehículo para llevar la venta transportándose por toda la zona de una mejor manera.
texts.en:
José is single and lives with his mother. He earns a living by selling bedding and in this way helps his mother cover household expenses. He works seven days a week selling his wares in nearby neighbourhoods.

José is seeking a loan to buy bedding in different colours since that is what his customers are asking for. He wishes to diversify into different styles to give his customers more choice and generate more sales. His goal is to buy a vehicle so he can more easily transport his merchandise throughout the area.

loans.use: to buy bedding in different colours

loans.name: Eivert Mario

texts.es:
El señor Eivert Mario tiene 36 años de edad y vive en una casa de propiedad de él y de sus hermanos gracias a la herencia que les dejaron sus padres. Vivienda que esta ubicada en el barrio Juan  de la ciudad deTarija. Eivert es padre de 1 hijo, a quien cuida y apoya en sus estudios, por circunstancias de la vida se separo de su esposa ahora el tiene que trabajar para poder sacar adelante a su hijo. Eivert se dedica desde hace mas de 3 años al servicio de topografo en una empresa constructora que prefieren ocupar sus servicios por ser una persona puntual y responsable. Por otro lado percibe ingresos por concepto de renta de taxi. Eivert quiere tener mejores ingresos para salir adelante junto con su hijo, pero el nos cuenta que tiene la necesidad de comprar una línea de taxitrufi. Es por eso que ahora el crédito será destinado para la compra dicha línea. Que será de gran necesidad para realizar el transporte de pasajeros de esa forma poder incrementar sus ingresos que mucha falta le hacen.                                                                                                                                                                                                        
Eivert nos cuenta que quiere mejorar las condiciones de su vehículo que tiene, por eso nos dice que el próximo crédito que solicite será para mejorar las condiciones de su vehículo.
texts.en:
Eivert Mario, 36, lives in a house that he and his siblings own thanks to an inheritance left to them by their parents.  This house is located in the city of Tarija’s Juan neighborhood.  Eivert is the father of a son who he cares for and supports his schooling.  Due to life’s circumstances, he separated from his wife and now he has to work to raise his son.  

For over three years Eivert has been employed as a Topographer by a construction firm that prefers to avail themselves of his services because he is a punctual and responsible person.  Additionally, however, he earns income leasing out a taxi.  Eivert wants to earn improved income through the taxi rental.  He wants better income in order to get ahead with his son.  He tells us that the opportunity to buy a cooperative taxi route has come up and this is what the loan would be used for.  This will be of great use to him to provide passenger transportation services and increase his income which he very much needs to do.

Eivert tells us that he wants to improve his vehicle’s condition so the next loan he will request will be to improve his vehicle’s condition.

loans.use: to buy a taxo route.

loans.name: Fabio

texts.es: Fabio, tiene la edad 62 de  años, está en unión libre y vive con  su esposa y sus 4 hijos  que son su mayor prioridad. El lo que quiere es realizar la compra de los insumos apara la asistencia de su almacigo. El cuanta con la experiencia y el terreno apto para la siembra de ese cultivo, lo que quiere es generar todas las ganancias para seguir adelante con su proyecto y así poderle ofrecer a sus hijos el estudio para que lleguen a ser profesionales en su futuro y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Fabio, 62, is in a common-law marriage and lives with his wife and their 4 children, who are his main priority.  What he wants to do is to purchase some supplies for his cultivations.  He has experience and land that is well-suited for coffee crops.  He wants to generate earnings to get ahead with his business, so that he can offer his children an education so they can become professionals in the future.  He also wants to provide a better quality of life for his family.  This is the first loan that he has taken from FUDECOSUR.  He has not taken other loans before from the state banks, but FUDECOSUR has provided him with a loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to plant coffee crops

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Juana, es una persona joven, viven en la comunidad de Thoqo Thaqo de la  provincia de Mizque del departamento de Cochabamba,   tiene un hijo, al padre de su hijo tuvo que dejarlo por el mal trato que les daba a su hijo y a ella, ahora  ella sola tiene que mantener y alimentarlo a su  hijo.
     Esta época por el desastre natural de la sequia su pequeña parcela de cebolla no maduro bien, este desastre le hizo fracasar en sus ingresos económicos que ella esperaba. 
     Juana es una persona joven  muy querida y respetada en el lugar donde vive, por lo dedicada a sus hijo  y su trabajo que a veces hasta tiene que trabajar en jornal en la agricultura para ganar algunos pesos y así mantener a su hijo, ella está solicitando el crédito para   comprar abono y semillas para mejorar sus cultivos  y aumentar su producción para mejorar sus ingreso económico y  darle así una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo y que  pueda asistir a la escuela  en mejores condiciones.  El crédito ayudara mucho a su hijo y a ella en el duro trabajo que realiza.
texts.en:
Juana is a young person living in the community of Thoqo Thaqo in Mizque Province, Cochabamba Department.  She has a son.  She had to leave the father of her son because of the poor way he treated her and their son.  Now, she must support and feed her son alone.

Because of the recent natural disaster (drought) her small onion crop did not mature well which led her to fail in obtaining the income she expected to.

Juana is a young, very well liked and respected person where she lives because of her dedication to her son and because of her work.  Sometimes she has to work as a day laborer in farming to earn a few pesos to support her son.

She is asking for a loan to buy manure and seeds to improve her crops and increase production to improve her income and provide a better quality of life for her son so that he can attend school in better condition.  The loan will help her and her son a lot in the hard work she does.

loans.use: to buy manure and seeds.

loans.name: Juana Pabla

texts.es: Juana Pabla es casada, tiene 28 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos 1 de los cuales esta estudiando, se dedica al tejido de cortes, sabanas y servilleta típicas, tiene 10 años de experiencia, inició este trabajo siendo trabajadora para otro negocio. Decide solicitar un préstamo para invertirlo como capital de trabajo para su propio negocio, en esta ocasión para la compra de Hilo de diferentes clases y colores, para seguir trabajando y mejorar sus ganancias, ya que su objetivo es que su negocio crezca.
texts.en: Juana Pabla is married and is 28 years old.  She has 2 children, 1 of whom is in school.  She has a business weaving traditional skirts, bedding and napkins.  She started out weaving for another business.  She has 10 years of experience in this type of work.  She decided to request a loan to invest in working capital for her own business, buying yarn of different types and colors, so that she can continue to work and improve her earnings.  Her goal is to see her business grow.

loans.use: to buy yarn

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia tiene 47 años, vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos en su casa propia. Hace más de 5 años se dedica a la crianza de cuyes, actividad que lo ejerce en el interior de su casa, en donde escogió un espacio para ser una granja. 
Asimismo se dedica en la venta productos o artículos para el hogar así como mercería, y los ofrece de manera ambulante en las ferias comerciales. Es así como se desarrolla sus días de trabajo, durante el día vende cuyes, en donde sus hijos la apoyan distribuyendo a los clientes que previamente han solicitado la cantidad de éstos animales y durante el resto del día, vende sus productos. Para ella lo más rentable es la venta de cuyes, por lo que se intensifica en su crianza y limpieza de sus galpones, así evitar enfermedades, que puede ocasionar serias pérdidas en su capital (cuyes) y sus ganancias. Por tanto desea continuar capacitándose en las técnicas de crianza de cuyes y tener su granja con los estándares de calidad. Por ello pide de su apoyo para que se concreten sus objetivos. Este será su crédito número 19 con MFP,  por lo que manifiesta que le servirá mucho este aporte para concretar sus objetivos. Con el crédito solicitado, lo invertirá en la compra de maderas y rejillas para nuevos galpones de su granja.
texts.en:
Julia, 47, lives with her husband and four children in her own house.  For over five years she’s been raising guinea pigs at home where she selected a space to set up her farm.  She also sells articles for the home as well as notions in an ambulatory manner at various markets.  This is how her work days unfold: during the day she sells guinea pigs, her children help her distribute them to customers who have previously ordered a certain number of these animals and during the rest of the day she sells her products.  For her, the guinea pig sales are the most profitable which is why she intensifies their care and cleaning the sheds to prevent illnesses which can cause serious loss of capital (guinea pigs) and profits.  Therefore, she wants to continue to learn guinea pig raising techniques to have a farm with the highest quality standards.  Because of this, she’s asking for your help to reach these goals.

This will be her loan #19 with MFP.  She states that it will be very helpful in the pursuit of her goals.  She will use the requested loan to buy lumber and lattices for new enclosures in her farm.

loans.use: to buy lumber and lattices to build more guinea pig enclosures.

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en:
Abbas is a 42-year-old married man and the father of two children. He has manufactured glass and mirrors since 2009. He likes this business, and is willing to improve it and update his machines as much as he can. Therefore, he has requested a loan from Al Majmoua, Kiva's partner, to buy a new machine required to etch glass and a computer to help search for new designs or to design new ones.

Abbas works hard to provide his children with the best education and healthy lives. He works hard to improve his business. Most of his customers say that he has very good quality products and that his prices are affordable to anyone. He hopes to expand his business more and more in the future.

loans.use: To buy a computer and a special machine to etch on glass.

loans.name: Maria Del Pilar

texts.es:
María tiene 41 años D. edad, es casada, vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos. Ella vive en una zona rural del distrito D. Catacaos en el departamento D. Piura al norte del Perú. Ella cuenta con los servicios básicos D. gua y energía electrica  en su comunidad.

Maria se se dedica al comercio y crianza D. animales menores. Pero su actividad  principal  la fabricación y venta D. peroles D. aluminio, tiene su pequeño taller en su vivienda.  Tiene más D. 04 años D. experiencia en dicha actividad, ella cuenta con clientes fijos los cuales son vendedores minoristas del mercado modelo, mochoqueque, otros. También cuenta con un pequeño negocio D. artículos D. bazar, esta actividad la realiza desD. hace más D. 10 años, que le han permitido adquirir experiencia y clientela fidelizada.

Maria está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa D. 1500 nuevos soles  con los que comprará animales y alimentos balanceados. Además desea mejorar en los corrales D. su domicilio ello le permitirá generar ingresos y así poder mejorar su calidad D. vida. 

Marìa es una madre D. familia emprendedora que goza D. buenas referencias y es reconocida como una persona entusiasta y responsable.
texts.en:
María tiene 41 años D. edad, es casada, vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos. Ella vive en una zona rural del distrito D. Catacaos en el departamento D. Piura al norte del Perú. Ella cuenta con los servicios básicos D. gua y energía electrica  en su comunidad.

Maria se se dedica al comercio y crianza D. animales menores. Pero su actividad  principal  la fabricación y venta D. peroles D. aluminio, tiene su pequeño taller en su vivienda.  Tiene más D. 04 años D. experiencia en dicha actividad, ella cuenta con clientes fijos los cuales son vendedores minoristas del mercado modelo, mochoqueque, otros. También cuenta con un pequeño negocio D. artículos D. bazar, esta actividad la realiza desD. hace más D. 10 años, que le han permitido adquirir experiencia y clientela fidelizada.

Maria está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa D. 1500 nuevos soles  con los que comprará animales y alimentos balanceados. Además desea mejorar en los corrales D. su domicilio ello le permitirá generar ingresos y así poder mejorar su calidad D. vida. 

Marìa es una madre D. familia emprendedora que goza D. buenas referencias y es reconocida como una persona entusiasta y responsable.

loans.use: Comprará animales y alimentos balanceados, asi como tambien realizar  mejorar en sus corrales .

loans.name: Nidia Violeta

texts.es:
Nidia  es socia del Banco Comunal “3 de Mayo” ubicado en el distrito Ilave, provincia  El Collao y departamento de Puno, tiene 25 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene una hija. Por diversos motivos no pudo concluir sus estudios superiores.
Desde hace  cinco años  trabaja  con el  Movimiento  Manuela  Ramos, su  primer préstamo  fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de artículos de joyería y reloj de diversos modelos.  Actualmente se dedica a la venta de zapatillas.
Con éste préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, comprará dos docenas de zapatillas para niños, dice que realiza sus compras en Desaguadero y las vende en la ciudad de Arequipa.  En el negocio le ayuda su esposo quien tiene trabajos eventuales (realiza soldaduras).
Su sueño es tener una tienda bien implementada de prendas de vestir y zapatillas.
Lo que le  gusta del Banco Comunal es la puntualidad y los ahorros que ganan.
En la foto podemos verla junto a su hija.
texts.en:
Nidia is a member of the communal bank "3 de Mayo," located in the Llave district of El Collao province in the department of Puno.  She is 25 years old, lives with a partner, and has a daughter.  For a number of reasons she was not able to complete her college studies.

She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos organization for 5 years.  Her first loan was for 300 Peruvian soles, which she invested in her business selling jewelry and a variety of models of watches.  Now she has a business selling sneakers.  

With this loan of 500 Peruvian soles, she will buy 2 dozen sneakers for children.  She says that she makes her purchases in Desaguadero, and sells her products in the city of Arequipa.  Her husband, who works part-time as a welder, helps her with the business. 

Her dream is to have a well-equipped store where she could sell clothing and sneakers.

What she likes about her communal bank is that the members are punctual with their payments, and she likes the interest that she gets on her savings.

In the photograph, you can see her with her daughter.

loans.use: to buy 2 dozen children's sneakers to sell

loans.name: Rosa Ivania

texts.es: Rosa casada su esposo trabaja como conductor de transporte urbano, su hijo lo tiene estudiando, que se prearan es el mayor deseo. Mujer emprendedora tiene su propio negocio venta de cosméticos desde hace tiempo ha sido un ingreso económico para la familia, lo inicio con fondo propios y ahora tiene los planes que con el préstamo invertirlo en la compra de mercadería: perfumes, crema de mano, pinturas de labios, uñas, sombra, marbellí y entre otros productos.  Ofreciendo a sus clientes mayor variedad, aumentando su venta y sus ingresos mejorando su nivel de vida. obteniendo beneficio para su familia.
texts.en: Rosa is married.  Her husband works as a urban transportation driver.  Her son is in school, and her greatest desire is that he is prepared.  Rosa is an enterprising woman who has her own business selling cosmetics.  For some time, this has been a source of income for her family.  She started the business with her own funds, and now has plans to use the loan to purchase merchandise: perfumes, hand cream, lipstick, nail polish, eye shadow, and other products.  She will be able to offer her customers a larger variety and will increase her sales and her income, which will improve her quality of life and benefit her family.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.es: Cirila tiene 51 años, vive con su con su hija en casa de su madre. Hace 12 años vende cerveza, negocio que le ejerce desde su propia casa, pero al mismo tiempo se dedica a la crianza de cuyes. Cirila, es trabajadora dependiente del municipio de su localidad, pero los fines de semana se dedica a éste negocio de la cerveza, y sólo ofrece su mercadería a personas que ya conoce, así asegura sus ganancias. Pero sabe también que debe vender de manera limitada este producto, sin embargo cuando se realizan festividades dentro de su localidad es cuando aprovecha en vender en cantidad.  Hoy su prioridad es crecer en este negocio y tener mayor ganancia. Este será su crédito número 10 con MFP,  por lo que espera el apoyo de todos ustedes para que pueda crecer su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de cajas de cervezas.
texts.en: Cirila, 51, lives with her daughter in her mother's home.  She has had a business selling beer for 12 years that she runs out of her house.  She also raises guinea pigs.  Cirila works for the municipal government, but on the weekends she sells beer.  She only offers her merchandise to people that she knows, which assures her some extra earnings, but she also knows that she should sell this product in a limited way.  However, when there are festivities in her area she can take advantage of the opportunity to sell in greater quantity.  Now her priority is to grow this business and have better earnings.  This will be her 10th loan with MFP, and she hopes that with this support from all of you, she can grow her business.  With the loan requested she will purchase cases of beer.

loans.use: to buy cases of beer

loans.name: Pedro Eduardo

texts.es: Pedro Eduardo tiene su actividad que es la venta de productos lácteos. Tiene más de 7 años en su negocio, Pedro tiene 3 hijos que trabajan de manera independiente. Inicio este medio de vida con la necesidad de sufragar ingresos diariamente a su hogar, es una persona muy inteligente siempre busca la forma de pagar sus cuotas. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de leche, cuajada, crema, leche agria y queso. Siempre busca la forma de mejorar cada día los ingresos de su hogar y es con la ayuda de los financiamientos que ha podido salir adelante.
texts.en:
Pedro Eduardo sells dairy products.  He’s been in business for over 7 years.  Pedro has three children who work independently.  He started this way of life needing to meet household daily expenses.  He is a very intelligent person who always finds ways to pay his installments.  


The loan he’s requesting is to buy milk, cheese, cottage cheese, buttermilk.  He always looks for a way to improve his household’s income every day and he’s been able to get ahead thanks to help from the loans.

loans.use: to buy dairy products.

loans.name: Ninosca

texts.es: Ninosca tiene 46 años, vive con sus 4 hijos en su casa propia. Hace más D. 10 años se dedica a L. crianza y venta D. cerdos, del mismo se dedica al cultivo D. papa y maíz. ElL. en compañía D. sus hijos ejecutan estás labores, que es indispensable para su sustento diario.  El establo que posee se encuentra dentro D. su casa, en el que diariamente se encarga D. su alimentación y procurar aumentar L. cantidad que tiene. Para elL., lo considera bastante rentable, L. venta D. cada animal tiene un precio muy alto, por ello desea intensificarse en su crianza. Por otro lado, trabaja cocinando para un restaurantes turísticos, así tiene un ingreso extra. En adelante desea tener mayor cantidad D. cerdos en su establo. Este será su crédito número 9 con MFP,  reconoce que el pertenecer a un banco comunal  le ha servido para mejorar su actividad a L. vez que admira L. solidaridad D. cada uno D. sus integrantes, por lo que renueva su compromiso D. seguir en su banco comunal siendo puntual en sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en L. compra D. sacos D. abono porque en esta oportunidad sembrará alfalfa que le servirá para alimentar a sus animales.
texts.en:
Ninosca, 46, lives with her four children in her own house.  For over ten years she’s been raising pigs to sell; she also raises corn and potatoes.  She does these chores, which are indispensable for her daily support, with help from her children.  Her stable is located in her house and she daily takes care of feeding and trying to increase the number she has.  For her, it’s quite profitable; the sale price of each animal is very high and this is why she wants to increase their number.  Additionally, she earns extra income working as a cook at a tourist restaurant.  In the future, she’d like to have a larger number of pigs in her stable.

This will be loan #9 with MFP.  She recognizes that being part of a communal bank has been very helpful for her to improve her business.  She admires the solidarity of each of its members so she renews her commitment to continue in the communal bank being very punctual with her payments.  

She will use the requested loan to buy sacks of manure because on this occasion she will plant alfalfa that will serve as animal feed.

loans.use: to buy sacks of manure.

loans.name: Cometas Group

texts.es:
Las cometas es un grupo al norte de la ciudad de Monterrey,  está compuesto por 8 señoras que tienen siempre un propósito para sobresalir, les gusta el nombre Cometas porque siempre  miran hacia arriba.

Entre ellas tenemos el ejemplo de la Sra. Ma Juana con 64 años de vida, viuda, con tres hijos de 28, 30 y 32 años los cuales son su orgullo por los buenos valores que les enseñó. Ma Juana saco adelante a sus hijos planchando y cosiendo (sewing). Oficios que a ido mejorando día a día; ahora ella tiene un pequeño taller donde maquila blusas. 

Con su préstamo planea seguir mejorando su taller ya que siempre lucha por lo que quiere y nunca se da por vencida.
texts.en:
“Las Cometas” (The Comets) is a group in the north of the city of Monterrey; it has 8 members whose purpose is to always excel.  They like the name ‘Cometas’ because they always are looking upwards.

Among them we have the example of María Juana, 64.  She’s a widow with three children who are 28, 30 and 32 years of age who are her pride for the good values she taught them.  María Juana raised her children taking in ironing and sewing, occupations that she’s improved daily.  Now, she has a small workshop where she assembles blouses. 

She plans to use the loan to continue improving her workshop because she always fights for what she wants and never gives up.

loans.use: to remodel her workspace and buy new sewing machines.

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es: Doña Ana Maria, esa casada, cursó los estudios de educación primaria, tiene 4 hijos 2 de los cuales estan estudiando, se dedica a la tejeduría, este ha sido su trabajo siempre desde niña ya que ha sido el trabajo de la familia, pero como propietaria del negocio lleva 5 años de experiencia. Decide organizar un grupo para solicitar otro préstamos que le servirá para comprar un telar, las otras integrantes del grupo se dedican a diversas actividades, a la tejeduría y al comercio. En el futuro quiere contar con varios trabajadores en su negocio.
texts.en:
Ana María is married.  She finished elementary school.  She has four children, two of whom are in school.  She is a weaver.  This has been her work since she was a little girl since it’s always been the family occupation.  As a business owner, however, she has five years experience.

She decided to organize a group to request another loan to buy a loom.  The other group members carry out a variety of activities like weaving and commerce.  In the future she’d like to have several employees in her business.

loans.use: to buy a loom.

loans.name: Roland

texts.en:
Roland owns Accurate Metalworks, a steel direction and welding company.  He has been operating his business for 13 years as a licensed, professional welder.  Roland lives in San Antonio, but travels all over the state of Texas working as a sub-contractor for commercial projects.  For example, Roland has done steel and welding work for state-funded projects in Austin and Belton, Texas, and also helped build an elementary school in Kingsville, Texas.  Roland currently has four employees, though this number fluctuates depending on his workload.  

This loan from ACCION Texas-Louisiana is helping Roland buy a gasoline-powered welding machine, as well as providing him with operating capital to run his business.  As a sub-contractor, Roland must wait for the general contractor to be paid before he receives compensation.  Having operating capital helps Roland compete for jobs he otherwise couldn’t by giving him the means to front project expenses.  Roland also views this loan as an opportunity for him to build his business’ credit, which will help facilitate further expansion in the future.

Family is a big part of Roland’s life. He routinely travels to Odessa to visit his daughter and spend time with his two infant grandsons.  To make the trip financially profitable, he and his daughter try to line up work for him during his visits, so that he can stay with them for days at a time.  He has volunteered with the Boy Scouts for years, and is currently helping his 16-year-old son qualify as an Eagle Scout.  His youngest daughter, who is 11, wants to be a marine biologist. Roland calls himself his kids’ biggest fan and works hard to support their dreams.  

Roland has relied on word-of-mouth advertising and referrals to generate business.  He recently started attending Hispanic Contractors Association meetings to network with professionals in the construction industry and get advice on how to better market his business.  His long-term goal for Accurate Metalworks is to build it into year-round business, and eliminate the downtime he experiences during the winter.  Because there are fewer projects going on during the winter, it can be difficult to find work.  He believes that he can achieve this by building stronger relations within the industry and making his company better known.

loans.use: to pay for a welding machine and provide operating capital

loans.name: Comerciantes De Pueblo Nuevo Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "LOS COMERCIANTES DE PUEBLO NUEVO" porque todas las integrantes desempeñan esa actividad, además de que es sinonimo de una persona trabajadora, esta ubicado en el estado de México. Es la primera vez que solicitan un prestamo, el grupo esta integrado por 10 personas, la señora Juana es una integrante del grupo, ella estudio solo la primaria, se dedica a la venta de mandiles y articulos de temporada en los tianguis, esta actividad la desempeña junto con su esposo. Ella se siente entusiasmada porque menciona que su esfuerzo va a permitir que su hija en un futuro puedan brindarle una buena educacion y se convierta en una profesionista. El prestamo lo solicitá para comprar mandiles y tambien tiene pensado comprar impermeables para esta epoca de lluvia que se aproxima, sus principales clientes son las personas que asisten a la plaza y consideran que es un producto que va a necesitar.
texts.en:
This group is called "LOS COMERCIANTES DE PUEBLO NUEVO" (The Pueblo Nuevo Merchants) because all the members are in this occupation; besides it’s a synonym for a hard working person.  It’s located in the State of México.  This is the first time they’ve requested a loan.  The group has ten members.

Juana is one of the group members.  She only completed primary school.  She sells aprons and seasonal items in the movable markets, an activity she carries out with her husband.  She is excited because she mentions that her effort will allow her to provide her daughter with a good education so that she can become a professional in the future.

The loan she’s requesting is to buy aprons.  She also plans to buy rain coats for the rainy season that is approaching.  Her main customers are people who visit the square and feel that it’s a product they are going to need.

loans.use: to buy aprons and rain coats.

loans.name: Fraternidad Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Fraternidad, inicia su ciclo 7, con 16 socias las cuales tienen diversos negocios como L. venta D. abarrotes en general, venta D. comida, queso, alfalfa, cereales, ropa, frutas y tambien materiales D. construcción.
Rosa, es L. presidenta para éste ciclo, tiene 47 años, es casada y tiene 5 hijos. Es D. profesión Técnica en Enfermería pero no ejerce por sus hijos. Se dedica a L. venta D. leña y cereales en su casa. Está en el banco comunal desD. su inicio. Le gusta las reuniones D. su Banco Comunal en FINCA Perú, porque se pueD. ahorrar. Con sus ahorros pagó L. educación D. sus hijos. Ahora está ahorrando para L. educación superior D. sus hijos. Su sueño es que su negocio siga creciendo y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The “Fraternidad” (Brotherhood) communal bank starts its 7th cycle with 16 members who have a variety of businesses like: general grocery sales, food sales, cheese, alfalfa, cereals, clothes, fruit and also building materials.

Rosa is the President for this cycle.  She’s 47 years old, married and has five children.  By profession, she’s a Practical Nurse but she does not practice due to her children.  She sells firewood and cereals at home.  She’s been in the communal bank since it began.  She likes her communal bank’s meetings at FINCA Perú because one can save.  She used her savings to pay for her children’s education.  Now, she’s saving up for her children’s higher education.  Her dream is that the business continues to grow and that her children become professionals.

loans.use: to buy cereals at wholesale.

loans.name: Maria Lourdes

texts.es: Maria se dedica a compra y venta de ropa. Hace más de 6 años que tiene este negocio, Maria tiene 3 hijos a su cargo, a pesar de sus dificultades que ha tenido que atravesar ya que el precio de la ropa ha aumentado, pero esto no le impidió a salir adelante con su actividad ya que siempre ha viajado a Managua en donde puede conseguir la ropa un poco más barata. El crédito es para la compra de  pantalones, faldas, camisas, vestido, trajes y ropa para niños.  Sueña con aumentar sus ingresos para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
María is a clothes merchant.  She’s had this business for over 6 years.  She has three children in her care.  Despite the difficulties she’s had to go through since the price of clothes has risen this has not kept her from getting ahead with her activity since she always has traveled to Managua where she can get the clothes a little less expensively.

The loan is to buy pants, skirts, shirts, dresses, suits and children’s clothes.  She dreams with increasing her income to improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Piedad

texts.es: Piedad tiene 59 años, vive con su hija y su nieta en su casa propia. Siempre se ha dedicado a las actividades agrícolas, con el paso D. los años obtuvo un trabajo dependiente en la municipalidad distrital D. su localidad, en donD. pasa la mayor parte D. su tiempo. Su hija es quien la ayuda en el cuidado D. los cuyes y gallinas que posee, y durante los fines D. semana los venD. y otro tanto lo usa para su consumo propio. Ella le gusta mucho el comercio D. animales menores, es así que los compra al por mayor y a un precio menor. D. esta manera se genera más ganancias, es por eso que ahora desea incrementar la cantidad D. animales que tiene. Este será su crédito número 11 con MFP,  esta muy contenta D. ser parte D. su banco comunal ya que através D. los años ha llegado a conocer a los integrantes D. su grupo comunal, por quienes considera como gente D. confiar. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá para comprar abono para sembrar maíz
texts.en:
Piedad, 59, lives with her daughter and granddaughter in her own house.  She has always been a farmer.  In time, she got a salaried job working for her local district municipality where she now spends most of her time.  Her daughter helps her care for the guinea pigs and chickens she has and on weekends she sells them and uses some of them for their own consumption.  She likes small animal commerce very much; she buys them at wholesale at a lower price.  This way she earns higher profits and this is why she now wants to increase the number of animals she has.

This will be loan #11 with MFP.  She is very happy to be part of her communal bank because throughout the years she has gotten to know the members well and considers them to be trustworthy people.

She will use the requested loan to buy manure to plant corn.

loans.use: to buy sacks of manure.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa  es socia del Banco Comunal “3 D. Mayo” ubicado en el distrito Ilave, provincia  El Collao y departamento D. Puno, tiene 76 años D. edad, es viuda y tiene cuatro  hijos independientes.  Tiene estudios D. educación primaria (incompleta)..
La señora  trabaja  con el Movimiento  Manuela  Ramos desD. hace cinco años, su  primer préstamo  fue por la suma D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio venta D. abarrotes.
Con éste  nuevo préstamo D. S/. 2000.00 nuevos soles, comprará mercaderías como fideos, arroz, azúcar, harina, aceite, leche,  conservas y detergentes, etc.  La señora nos cuenta que venD. sus productos en las diferentes ferias D. las comunidades D. Ilave, incluso los domingos. En el negocio la ayuda su nieta.
Su sueño es seguir con el negocio y mejorar sus ganancias.
Lo que le  gusta del Banco Comunal son los ahorros.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the May 3rd Community Bank located in the Llave district, El Collao Province, department of Puno. She is a 76-year old widow with four grown children. She studied, but did not complete primary school. 

She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for more than five years. Her first loan was for 300 new soles, which she used to invest in her snack food business. With this new loan of 2,000 new soles, she will buy merchandise such as noodles, rice, sugar, flour, oil, milk, detergents and other goods. She sells her products at different fairs and markets in the communities of Llave. She even works on Sundays. Her granddaughter helps her with her business.

Her dream is to continue with her business and to earn more profit. The thing she likes most about the Community Bank is the savings.

loans.use: purchase merchandise like noodles, rice, sugar, flour, oil, milk, detergents, and other prodcuts.

loans.name: Roció Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Roció Isabel es madre de familia y tiene tres hijos que están estudiando y que son su responsabilidad. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para poder pagar las mensualidades de la inscripción de la escuela donde están estudiando sus hijos.
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte de su sueldo que obtiene de su trabajo como jefa de sistema de una compañía de nieve. Ya que es la fuente de ingreso que tiene para su familia.
Desea que sus hijos tengan los estudios necesario para salir adelante en la vida.
texts.en: Mrs. Rocio Isabel is the mother of three school-age children who she must provide for. She is applying for a loan to pay the monthly tuition fees for the school where her children study. She plans on paying off this loan with a part of her salary as the head of systems for a company that sells ice. She hopes her children will have the necessary education to improve their lives.

loans.use: pay for school costs

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos  tiene 30 años, vive con su pareja y su hija en casa de sus padres. Hace más de 4 años que ofrece el servicio de transporte, para ello cuenta con una  movilidad que alquiló, de esa manera trabaja independientemente, recorriendo las calles de su ciudad  en busca de pasajeros. Sabe que este trabajo tiene sus riesgos, como ser victima de asaltos y accidentes, por lo que últimamente se ha dado en su localidad. Sin embargo tiene sus recompensa el sacrificio, ya que percibe un ingreso considerable que le ayuda a sostener a su familia. Generalmente su horario de trabajo es todo el día y descansa por las noches.  Considera que esta actividad es rentable porque es un servicio muy requerido y demandado por lo que  desea tener mas adelante su propia movilidad. Este será su crédito número 19 con MFP, y espera ser cumplida en sus pagos. Además le agrada ser integrante de su banco comunal porque su grupo se mantiene unido  por varios años  y le han enseñado a ser responsable en sus cuentas. Se muestra agradecido por el apoyo financiero en anteriores veces que le ha servido mucho para desarrollar su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de algunos repuestos para el carro que alquila.
texts.en:
Carlos, 30, lives with his spouse and daughter in his parents’ house.  He has been offering transportation services for over four years.  To do so, he has a car that he has leased.  He works independently traversing the city streets looking for passengers.  He knows that this type of work has its risks, like being a victim of assaults and accidents, which his community has recently started to experience.  However, the sacrifice does have its rewards since he earns considerable income that helps him support his family.  

His usual work schedule is all day; he rests nights.   He considers this activity to be profitable because it’s a very needed and sought after service.  Because of this he’d like in the future to own his own car.

This will be his loan #19 with MFP and he expects to make his payments.  Besides, he enjoys being part of his communal bank because his group stays together for several years and has taught him to be responsible with his accounts.  He is grateful for the previous financial help that has been very useful for his business’ development.  He will use the loan he’s requesting to buy some spare parts for the car he leases.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his car.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina es socia del Banco Comunal “3 de Mayo” ubicado en el distrito Ilave, provincia  El Collao y departamento de Puno, tiene 38 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene un hijo.  Cristina solo estudió la primaria.
La señora es una socia nueva que recientemente trabaja  con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá en la compra de tres ovejas para su respectivo engorde por dos meses.  Dice que las compra y las vende en la localidad de Ilave.  También cuenta que la señora trabaja en el sembrío de papa, quinua, habas, etc.
Su sueño es tener más ovejas y así tener más ganancias.
Lo que le  gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en:
Cristina is a member of the “3 de Mayo” (May 3) communal bank located in Ilave District, El Collao Province and Puno Department.  She’s 38 years old and is a single mother of one son.  Cristina only completed elementary school.

She is a new member who just recently started collaborating with the Manuela Ramos Movement.  She needs a 500 new sol loan to buy three sheep to fatten up for two months.  She says that she buys them and sells them in Ilave.  She also relates that she works farming potatoes, quinoa, broad beans, etc.  Her dream is to own more sheep to have higher profits.   What she likes about the communal bank is the ease of the loans.

loans.use: to buy three sheep.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en:
Gabriel owns Green Dog Services, a business that specializes in pest control service.  Gabriel, who has over seven years of experience in the pest control industry, launched his business in early May, 2011 after months of planning and preparation.  The grand opening of his business is timely, as it marks the beginning of the summer season, the busiest time of the year for the pest control industry.

Born and raised in Mexico, Gabriel came to the United States 14 years ago.  Before working in pest control, he worked for several years as a salesman in the music industry.  This experience took him all over the state of Texas and Northern Mexico.  From his accumulated experience, Gabriel half-jokingly says that if there is one thing he has learned about Americans, it is that they love good customer service.   Knowing this, he sees excellent customer service as being as much a part of his business as the expertise he provides.  He says that it is crucial to build and maintain customer relationships, because satisfied customers are the cheapest form of advertising.  As he points out, someone can look up pest control companies in the phonebook, but they are most likely to work with a company recommended to them by a friend.

As a native Spanish speaker, Gabriel says that being bilingual is helping him find a niche for his business within the Hispanic community.  “There is a lot of competition in this industry, but Hispanics are looking for someone they can speak Spanish with, and I think that helps me.  I’m not the only one (who speaks Spanish), but I’m one of the only ones with his own company.”  Though he wants to continue building relationships within the Hispanic community, he also wants to connect his business with the greater community.  One way he is doing this is by going through neighborhoods, meeting people, and making them aware of the services he offers.

This loan from ACCION Texas-Louisiana helps Gabriel pay the necessary fees for registering his business. He says that the government has strict requirements for pest control, and that navigating through the paperwork can be as expensive as it is time-consuming.  It is important that he be officially registered and certified so that he can offer all of his expertise.  For example, he has yet to receive approval to treat termites, leaving him unable to provide one of the key services his business offers.  

Aside from helping Gabriel receive all of the necessary certifications, this loan is helping him purchase business cards and launch a small marketing campaign.  He wants to advertise his business in local newspapers and magazines.  Gabriel has already undertaken a less expensive form of advertising by walking through neighborhoods and handing out business fliers.  Before receiving this loan, Gabriel financed his startup costs with his personal savings and credit card.

loans.use: to pay for state registration fees and a marketing campaign

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luís  tiene  21 años de edad, es soltero y  vive en casa de sus padres, la misma que esta  ubicada en una zona rural llamada  la Campiña la Arenita en el distrito de Paijan.

Luis  se dedica a ofrecer servicio de transporte público en un mototaxi (moto con cabina para transportar personas), dicha mototaxi es de su propiedad.  Con esta vehiculo cubre las rutas de los caseríos mas cercanos a su localidad.

Luis está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para la  reparación de su vehículo y mantenimiento de rodajes, llantas y carpas, el necesita hacerle este manteniendo a su vehiculo, para que este pueda brindar un  mejor servicio.

El tiene buenas referencias por parte de sus vecinos y conocidos, es una persona trabajadora y responsable.
texts.en:
Luís  tiene  21 años de edad, es soltero y  vive en casa de sus padres, la misma que esta  ubicada en una zona rural llamada  la Campiña la Arenita en el distrito de Paijan.

Luis  se dedica a ofrecer servicio de transporte público en un mototaxi (moto con cabina para transportar personas), dicha mototaxi es de su propiedad.  Con esta vehiculo cubre las rutas de los caseríos mas cercanos a su localidad.

Luis está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para la  reparación de su vehículo y mantenimiento de rodajes, llantas y carpas, el necesita hacerle este manteniendo a su vehiculo, para que este pueda brindar un  mejor servicio.

El tiene buenas referencias por parte de sus vecinos y conocidos, es una persona trabajadora y responsable.

loans.use: Realizar reparaciones a su mototaxi.

loans.name: Esmeraldas De San Francisco Group

texts.es: ESTE GRUPO SE LLAMA "ESMERALDAS D. SAN FRANCISCO" EL GRUPO ELIGIO ESTE NOMBRE POR SER BONITO Y PARA QUE SE SOSTENGA FIRME CON EL APOYO D. TODAS SUS INTEGRANTES. EL GRUPO SE ENCUENTRA UBICADO EN EL ESTADO D. MÉXICO. EL PUEBLO SE DISTINGUE POR LA GRAN RESPONSABILIDAD Y AMABILIDAD D. SU GENTE. LA SEÑORA SE LLAMA ANDREA QUIEN ES UNA INTEGRANTE DEL GRUPO, ELLA TIENE LA EDAD D. 41 AÑOS, SU COMERCIO ES LA VENTA D. SERVILLETAS, SE SIENTE AGRADECIDA CON TODOS SUS CLIENTES PUES GRACIAS A ELLOS ELLA PUED. SALIR ADELANTE AUN QUE TAMBIEN CONSIDERA QUE LO QUE HACE ES REALMENTE MUY BUENO, ES SU LA TERCERA VEZ QUE SOLICITAN UN PRESTAMO. LA SEÑORA ANDREA QUIERE ESTE PRESTAMO PARA COMPRAR TELAS E HILOS Y ASÍ HACER MAS SERVILLETAS BORDADAS PUES CONSIDERA QUE EL INCREMENTAR LE DA ANIMOS PARA QUE SU GENTE ESTE CONTENTA. POR EL MOMENTO QUIERE CONTINUAR CON UNA ESTABILIDAD EN SU NEGOCIO Y ESPERA SEGUIR OBTENIENDO GANANCIAS PARA LOGRAR MAS OPORTUNIDADES D. TRABAJO. TAMBIÉN OFRECERLE A SU FAMILIA UNA MEJOR CALIDAD D. VIDA Y APOYO ECONOMICO PARA QUE NO LES FALTE NADA.
texts.en:
This group is called “Esmeraldas D. San Francisco” (San Francisco Emeralds).  The group chose this name because it’s pretty and so that it will remain strong with help from all the members.  The group is located in the State of México.  The town is noted for its great responsibility and the kindness of its people.

Andrea, 41, is one of the group members.  She sells napkins.  She is grateful to all her customers because thanks to them she can get ahead although she also considers that what she does is really good.  

This is her third loan request.  Andrea wants this loan to buy fabric and thread to make more embroidered napkins because she feels that by increasing she is encouraged so that her people will be happy.  For the moment she wants to continue with stability in her business and hopes to continue earning profits to obtain more opportunities for work and offer her family a better quality of life and economic support so that they will lack nothing.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread to make napkins and embroidery.

loans.name: Rosalía

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora Rosalía le está haciendo falta la barda alrededor, es por eso que esta solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar el material que es block, cemento y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de realizar la mejora. 
Doña Rosalía y su esposo el señor Hector desean la seguridad de sus dos pequeños hijos ya que pasan el mayor tiempo en la casa. 
Planea pagar el crédito con la pensión que recibe la señora Rosalía, Don Hector se encargara de los gastos familiares con el ingreso que obtiene de su trabajo.
texts.en:
Rosalía’s house is lacking a wall around its perimeter.  This is why she’s asking for a loan.  She wants to be able to buy materials like concrete blocks and cement and to pay the person who will do the improvement.

Rosalía and her husband, Héctor, want security for their two small children who spend most of their time at home.

She plans to repay the loan with a stipend Rosalía gets; Héctor will see to family expenses with the income he gets from his work.

loans.use: to erect a wall around her house.

loans.name: Mussarat's Group

texts.en:
Mussarat has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her husband’s livestock dairy business. Currently he has a cow and a buffalo at his home. He used to get milk from them to sell to his community clients. With the loan, he will purchase another cow, which will not only increase his stock but also increase the milk productivity. This will help him sell a larger quantity and increase his income. He has been operating this business for the past 20 years and Mussarat is confident that an investment will help him increase his profits. 

Mussarat herself is a midwife. She is an expert in her work and has been doing midwifery for many years. Besides her work, she also manages her household work actively. She has given birth to a son who is 9 years old and studying in class 2nd. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.

loans.use: To buy another cow

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en:
Shamim is a widow who lost her husband a few years ago. It was a very difficult time but she never lost hope and worked very hard to raise her only son who is now 25 years old. Her son is involved in a livestock business. He purchases goats and sheep when they are young, raises them and sells them to butchers. Shamim is 56 years old and performs her daily routine tasks by staying at home.
 
Shamim has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her son because he wants to buy some goats to expand his business. This will help him increase his sales by fulfilling the demand of the clients and earn a better income. Shamim is very hopeful that his business will be improved further after investing loan money into it. She is a new loan applicant and this is her first loan application to Asasah.

loans.use: To buy goats

loans.name: Sarafeen's Group

texts.en: Sarafeen is 43 years old and the mother of five children. Her eldest son left his education after 5th and started a business selling construction supplies. Her remaining children are continuing their education. Her husband operates a business selling milk. Sarafeen is a housewife who stays at home and does her household responsibilities. In her spare time, she also helps her husband operate his business. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who will buy another buffalo with the loan. This will help him sell a good quantity of milk and increase his profits. He has been operating this business for the past 16 years and Sarafeen is hopeful that an investment will bring even more profits to him. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for milk-selling business

loans.name: Rozina's Group

texts.en: Rozina is 40 years old and has given birth to four sons. Her eldest son operates a grocery store and the others are studying in a local school. Rozina supports her family by sewing clothes. She is an expert in her work and can sew designer and non-designer clothes easily. Due to her work, she receives a good number of orders every month from her community clients. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the expansion of her son’s grocery store business. With the loan, he will buy groceries like sugar, spices, rice etc to be able to fulfill the client orders on time and to increase his profits. Rozina is expecting that her son’s business will improve and her family will be able to make their life better as a result of the loan investment.

loans.use: To buy groceries like sugar, spices, rice etc for her son to sell

loans.name: Shahida's Group

texts.en:
Shahida is 50 years old and married with four children. Her eldest son sells clothes and the second one makes shoes. Her remaining children are getting their education. Shahida herself is a housewife who stays at home and does her household tasks. Her husband is a blacksmith and makes iron boxes on order. The iron boxes are used to keep clothes and other household items. He has been doing this business for the past 25 years. 

Shahida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who will buy iron in bulk to make a larger quantity of iron boxes, which will help him fulfill the orders on time and earn more profits. She is hopeful that with the loan, her husband will be able to improve his business condition to help her family enjoy better facilities of life.

loans.use: to buy iron in bulk to make iron boxes

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a business-lady who operates a green grocer. She has been operating the business for six years, with two employees. She also has rental houses, which helps her earn extra income. 

Being a single-mother of two, Jane works hard to provide for her family. In five years, she hopes to have her own business premise instead of renting.  She needs 40, 000 KES to buy potatoes and tomatoes.

loans.use: To buy potatoes and tomatoes.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 27 years old and single. He has been operating a grocer shop for three years, with one employee. Previously, he was selling cabbages and was able to add other vegetables and fruits after earning more profit.  

Through the trainings conducted by Faulu Kenya, David has learned business management skills. This has helped him to run his business well. He has requested for 40, 000 KES to renovate his business premises.

loans.use: To renovate his business premises.

loans.name: Khalida's Group

texts.en:
Khalida is a 56-year-old housewife who spends most of her time staying at home and taking care of her family. Her husband is an electrician by profession and provides electrical repair services to his clients. He is very good at his work. Two of Khalida’s sons also work to contribute to the family financially. Her eldest son is an electrician, the second one is a motor mechanic and the other two are studying. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband because he wants to buy electrical repair tools to improve his business. Khalida hopes that after the investment, her husband will be able to provide better service to his clients and increase his profits. She is a new loan applicant and this is her first loan application to Asasah.

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Khalida.

loans.use: To buy electrical repair tools

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix is a married man. He has three children. Felix does welding to earn a living. He has been in the business for only one year.  He has employed two people to assist him in his tasks. 

Felix hopes to grow his business and to open other outlets in the future. He has requested for 20,000 KES to buy a grinder and a drill.

loans.use: To buy a grinder and a drill.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy ingredients such as rice, maize flour, wheat four and salt.

loans.name: Salima's Group

texts.en:
Salima is 49 years old and has given birth to six children. Two of the children work and the others are studying by attending a local school. Salima is a housewife who stays at home and does her household responsibilities. She is very active and performs her duties very well. Her husband is a fruit seller by profession. He put his fruits on a cart every day and visits different streets of the city to sell. He works very hard to bear the financial expenses of the family. 
 
Salima has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. He will use the loan to purchase fresh seasonal fruits in bulk quantity, which will help him sell more to his customers and earn a better income. He has been operating this business for the past five years and Salima is confident that her husband’s business will improve after the loan investment. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.

loans.use: To buy fresh seasonal fruits to sell

loans.name: Evans

texts.en: Evans is 38 years old, married and has four children. He repairs worn out shoes to earn a living. He has eleven years of experience in the business. Evans was previously employed before he went into the business. He is determined to expand his business in the future. With 20, 000 KES, he will buy shoe soles and leather for repairing shoes.

loans.use: To buy shoe soles and leather for repairing shoes.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en: Martin is 36 years old, married, and a father of two.  He runs a nursery school which is affiliated with a church.  The school is only one year old and he has employed three people.  He was able to start the school through financial support from Faulu Kenya.  He hopes to expand the school and register more pupils.  He has requested 20, 000 KES to buy desks and chairs for the classroom.

loans.use: to buy desks and chairs for the classroom.

loans.name: Titus

texts.en: Titus is a 39-year-old single man.  He has been a livestock farmer for thirteen years.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has become more focused on his business.  His dream is to expand it and open butcheries.  He believes that through his hard work, he will succeed.  He has requested 20,000 KES to buy goats.

loans.use: to buy goats.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to plant tea.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a twenty nine year old married man with three children.  He lives in his own semi permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a motorcycle rider and a farmer who has been in these businesses for six years with minimal challenges, such as motorcycle breakdowns. He dreams of educating his children and of owning five motorcycles for his transport business. Joseph needs this loan to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy firewood for brick making.

loans.name: Hamis

texts.en:
Hamis is 45 years old and a father of seven children aged 2-15 years. Being the only breadwinner of his family of 10 people, Hamis works hard to provide for them. He lives in a small village in Hoima District in western Uganda. He lives in his own house with his family, and his family goal is to educate his children. 

Hamis is a produce dealer and has been in this trade for five years now; however, it has not been a smooth road for him because of the frequently fluctuating prices. He needs a loan to buy beans and maize for resale.

loans.use: to purchase maize and beans for resale.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is a fifty four year old married man with five children and he owns a house in Kasese Uganda. He has been keeping poultry and has also been an architect.  Ten years ago he started with 100 birds that cost him one million and now has 900 birds an equivalent of nine million. His hardship is a lack of enough feeds plus high prices for the feeds and his vision is having 2,000 birds plus educating his family. Samuel needs the loan to buy poultry feeds.

loans.use: To buy feeds for poultry.

loans.name: Gertrude

texts.en: Gertrude is 39 years old and single mother of four children ages 4 to 18 years old. She has no dependents and she is the soul bread winner. She has to go the extra mile to fend for her family of five people. She lives in a rented home in Hoima Uganda. For seven years she has been running a retail shop and she got her initial capital from the sale of farm produce but she faces a challenge of inadequate capital. Gertrude needs a loan to purchase general merchandise like sugar,salt, books, and soft drinks.

loans.use: To purchase general merchandise for her shop like sugar, rice, and salt.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase water, soda, and beer to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cement, iron sheets, and mattresses to sell.

loans.name: Judas

texts.en: Judas is 38 years old and married with four children ages 13-4 years. He lives in his own home with his wife and their children in Kibaale district Uganda. For three years he has been operating a motorcycle business and he bought his first motorcycle with the savings he made from his piggery project. He hopes in the future to upgrade his business to a taxi. Judas wants a loan to buy a another motorcycle.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for his transport business.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en: Sophia is a thirty five year old married mother with four children who owns a house in Kasese Uganda. She has been in the transport business for two years in which she started with one motorcycle and now has two motorcycles. Her hardship is a lack of enough capital and her vision is for more motorcycles. Sophia needs money to pay school fees.

loans.use: To pay school fees.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is 21 years old and lives in the town of Nyendo in the Masaka region of Uganda. She is married and has two children, both of whom are currently in school. Amina has a small retail shop, which she has run for five years.
To help expand her business, Amina has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more essential commodities, such as sugar, for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Amina hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. In the future, she hopes to build a poultry farm house.
Amina is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase more essential commodities, such as sugar, for resale.

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en:
Jacob is 46 years old, married, and has seven children between 32 and 21. He has other dependents and lives in his own home with his family of 10 people in Hoima, Uganda. 

He has had a video show business for 10 years. He first started his business in a rented premises but later built his own premises where he now operates his business. Jacob intends to use the loan to purchase a music system.

loans.use: To purchase a music system.

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en:
Oliver is a married mother of seven children between 8 and 28 years old. She has other dependents and she is the sole breadwinner for her family in Hoima, Uganda. 

For two years now she has been operating a retail shop which she started with the savings she made from selling tobacco. She faces a challenge of poor roads which hinder transportation of her goods. Oliver needs a loan to purchase sugar, salt, and plates for resale.

loans.use: To purchase salt, sugar, and plates for resale.

loans.name: Shadrack

texts.en:
Shadrack is 35 years old and lives in the Gardnersville area; he’s single and has no children. For the past six years Shadrack has been running a mini shop where he sells many items (Cosmetic, Footwear, rice, milk, etc). One of the main problems he faces is that he has low capital to build up his business.

Shadrack is requesting a loan to purchase more bags of rice for his business. He plans to advance his business and take care of his family.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of rice for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy toothpaste, washing soap, bath soap, rice, and many items for her business.

loans.name: Liliana Del Pilar

texts.es:
Liliana tiene 26 años de edad,  tiene 1 hijo a su cargo.  Vive en con algunos familiares en un centro poblado llamado Narihuala en la provincia de catacaos la cual es una comunidad pequeña.

 Ella cuenta con una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio la cual es atendida por ella misma. Allí ofrece en venta a sus vecinos y clientes de la zona diversos productos de consumo diario, entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes, ella se dedica a este negocio hace un año. El negocio cuenta con muy buena acogida. Adicionalmente se dedica a la agricultura. Con estas actividades ella ayuda a su esposo con el sostenimiento económico de su familia.

Liliana está solicitando un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles, este dinero lo utilizará para comprar mas mercadería y acondicionar su negocio  de esta manera Liliana satisfacerá su demanda ya que en los últimos meses se ha incrementado. 

Liliana, espera hacerse mas conocida a través de la promoción que le hagan sus clientes actuales, pues es una mujer trabajadora y responsable. Que con mucho esmero y trabajo desea poder brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
